title: Technical SEO Specialist
description:
**What we do**


We are passionate believers in the power of education to transform people’s lives. We play our part by helping students to make one of the most important decisions of their lifetime; finding, applying, and enrolling in the right study program. Our multi-sided platforms help over 120 million prospective students every year to find their ideal match from over 5500 partner institutions on our global network of over 500 student websites.


It’s a complicated, and diverse problem space and we work tirelessly to understand the needs of each individual student, and each individual institution, and use the power of technology to recommend the best matches for the benefit of both parties.


At Keystone, we work energetically with all aspects of SEO, and we also get recognition for these, as an example we have twice been rewarded for the best SEO work in our field in Sweden.

**About the role**


We are looking for a driven and passionate Technical SEO Specialist with a few years' experience, who wants to take the next exciting step in the career.


Driving organic traffic is a core part of our business and something that breathes withing the whole organization. You will be joining the product and tech team. Well-formulated communication skills will be needed, speaking to engineers, PMs, UX, and stakeholders in the business, with non-technical terms.


You will be a central part of the continuous growth journey that we have in front of us.

**What You’ll Do**

* Crawling and finding issues at scale on websites targeting a global audience.
* Research organic growth opportunities and provide actionable insights on how to achieve them.
* Analyze website traffic, internal linking structures, data related to indexing, and other elements to provide recommendations for optimization.
* Optimize site structures, URLs, and internal linking.
* Stay up to date with SEO industry trends and Google algorithm changes to ensure we adapt accordingly.
* Collaborate with web developers, Product Managers, UX and Marketing to implement SEO best practices.
* With a data-driven approach continually investigate different data sources to see how we can enrich content at scale.

**What We’re Looking For**

* At least 2 years of experience working within the SEO industry.
* Good understanding of industry tools such as Screaming Frog, Sitebulb, Oncrawl or similar.
* Good understanding of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.
* In-depth understanding of GA4 and GSC.
* Skilled in Google Sheets/Excel being able to draw insights from raw data.
* Good understanding of how search engines work.
* A burning passion for SEO in general, and knowledge of what it takes to create good content for users.
* Good proficiency in the English language, and able to communicate technical things in a non-technical way.
* Understanding of international SEO is highly preferred.

**Preferred qualifications**

* Proficiency in Python.
* Have experimented with Large Language Model APIs.
* Experience in larger site migrations.
* Experience in creating technical SEO documentation, guidelines and valuable reports.
* Experience in holding presentations and workshops for larger audiences.

**What can we offer you?**

* An International and open working atmosphere with colleagues of many nationalities.
* To be in the lead of a fast-growing company.
* Plenty of space for initiative and the ability to grow your own skills and experience.
* Awesome colleagues and a social working environment.
* Hybrid working, but with a team that also enjoys meeting up IRL and having a Friday beer or Monday breakfast at the office found centrally in Stockholm.
* To be a part of a team who cares deeply for our customers.

**What's the team like?**


You will be a part of the Product team, working closely on a day-to-day basis with our in-house engineering team.


You will be reporting to our Senior Technical SEO Manager and be part of a larger product and tech team consisting of 30+ engineers and product managers from diverse backgrounds and experiences.


Collaborative, ambitious and driven best describes us. You will be joining a strong and growing team with great chemistry who are passionate about what they do and always go the extra mile to reach their goals. Read more about us here: https://www.keg.com/


Do you want to join our family? Please send us your application by hitting the button "Apply here!".

*Keystone is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are deeply committed to fostering an inclusive environment for all employees.*

title: UX/UI Designer
description:
**Do you want to join the technological revolution? Tendium is looking for a** 
***UX/UI Designer***
**to join the team.**
 Do you consider yourself a visionary thinker on the prowl for a fresh challenge? Do you also have a proven track record in the SaaS industry? Then we want you to join us on our journey!
   

  

 Why Tendium
   

  

 Tendium is a tech company working in the space between technology and customers. Through advanced machine-learning technologies, we are revolutionising industries with modern, efficient methods, creating new possibilities to democratise both the public and the private sector markets. The team at Tendium is expanding, with everyone from data scientists to salespeople working side by side, and now we want you to join us.
   

  

 We are an ever-growing company comprised of some of the sharpest minds in Sweden. With such talent, we at Tendium naturally believe in a flat hierarchy, where everyone has responsibility, autonomy and the opportunity to provide input. Since we are increasing in size significantly, new opportunities are emerging constantly. We require ambitious, conscientious and value-driven new colleagues to help grow the business. If you are successful in becoming a part of our team, we promise to provide a dynamic, intellectually stimulating workplace. We believe that personal and professional development is crucial and as such you will have the opportunity to take on real responsibility from day one.
   

  

 The Job
   

  

 As a UX/UI Designer at Tendium you will play a pivotal role in driving the creative direction and design strategy of our organisation. You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including Product Owners, Software Engineers, and our Marketing Team, to ensure that design initiatives are seamlessly integrated into our products and services.
   

  

 We imagine that you will be responsible for guiding and inspiring our team to create innovative and impactful solutions. Your excellent design knowledge and leadership skills will be instrumental in creating our brand's future and bringing our users only the best possible experiences.
   

  

 Simply put, you have a passion for design, innovation, and a keen eye for detail.
   

  

*We are primarily looking for candidates in Stockholm and the surrounding areas. This is a full-time position with a 6-month probationary period.*
**As a UX/UI Designer at Tendium, your main focus areas will be:**
* Setting the creative direction and design standards for our organisation, ensuring that our design language and brand identity are consistently upheld across all touchpoints.
* Collaborate with Product Owners, Software Engineers, and other stakeholders to define design goals, requirements, and project timelines, and develop strategies to meet those objectives.
* Drive the end-to-end design process, including research, ideation, concept development, prototyping, and execution, while ensuring a user-centered approach.
* Turning complex user flows and advanced features into intuitive, seamless experiences by seeing the big picture and optimising connections.
* Create and maintain design systems, style guides, and UI/UX patterns to streamline design workflows and ensure consistency.
* Conduct regular design reviews and provide constructive feedback to ensure high-quality design outputs and continuous improvement.
* Stay updated with the latest design trends, tools, and technologies, and recommend innovative solutions to enhance our design capabilities.
* Advocate for user experience and accessibility, championing the importance of usability, clarity, and inclusivity in all design deliverables.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather and analyse user feedback, conduct usability testing, and iterate on designs to optimise user satisfaction and engagement.


**Qualifications**
* 3+ years of experience working in a similar role, preferably in a fast-paced and innovative tech-environment.
* Previous experience working as a Designer for SaaS companies.
* Proficiency in using Figma.
* Bachelor's degree in design, visual communication, or a related field.
* Strong portfolio showcasing your design expertise across a variety of projects, including digital interfaces (and preferably prototypes and process of the same), print materials, branding, and visual storytelling.
* Strong project management skills, including the ability to prioritise tasks, manage timelines, and drive projects to completion.
* Experience with design thinking methodologies and conducting user research is highly desirable.


**It is merited if one or more of the following points apply to you:**
* 5+ years of experience designing for SaaS companies.
* Knowledge of front-end development technologies is a plus.
* Proficiency in creating clickable prototypes.


 Application
   

  

 We look forward to your application. We recruit on an ongoing basis, so apply as soon as possible. Successful candidates will initially be invited to an initial interview where you will have the opportunity to meet the team.
   

  

 To make this process even more efficient, feel free to sign in to your Connect profile and add your references at any stage.
   

  

 Please find additional information on our recruitment process
 *here.*
 If you want to know more about our culture and what you can expect when working at Tendium you can read more about it
 *here.*
**Equality and inclusion statement**
 At Tendium we celebrate diversity and are committed to fostering an inclusive workplace. We welcome applications from individuals of all backgrounds, recognising that a diverse team enhances creativity and innovation. Join us in creating an environment where everyone can thrive and contribute their unique perspectives.
   

  

 At Tendium we’re using data to transform public procurement, giving our clients better access to public tenders and helping governments to curb waste and enhance transparency.
   

  

 For more information contact career@tendium.com

title: UX/UI Designer
description:
At Ubiquiti Inc., we create technology platforms for Businesses, Smart Homes, and Internet Service Providers, driven by our goal to connect everyone, everywhere by Rethinking IT. To date, Ubiquiti has shipped over 100 million devices worldwide, from ISP networking products to next generation of IT solutions. At Ubiquiti, you’ll heighten your potential and broaden your horizons, while shaping the future of connectivity.
   

  

**We are currently looking for a highly skilled UX/UI Designer to our team in Stockholm, Sweden.**
***Please be aware that a valid work permit is a mandatory requirement to be considered for the role.***
**Responsibilities**
* Design high-quality and user-friendly interfaces for web and mobile. Examples: UniFi Network app, UniFi Protect app, UniFi Design System, ui.com, store.ui.com, design.ui.com and more
* Embrace a design-first approach, pushing the boundaries of design by working on new and innovative ideas
* Co-work with key stakeholders including leadership, strategists, developers (FE/FS) and other designers
* Navigate an agile work environment, iterating quickly yet maintaining high quality
* Actively participate in mulitple projects across the company and voice your ideas on design improvements


**Requirements**
* Expert level UX and UI design skills
* Minimum five (5) years of experience designing interfaces for web and mobile
* Highly proficient in Figma
* Strong interest in working hands-on with design, considering both user experience and UIs
* You take full ownership of your tasks and responsibilites
* Genuine passion for great UX
* Excellent communication skills and highly proficient in English (written and spoken)


**Nice To Have**
* Knowledge about networking & wireless technologies
* Experience with Adobe After Effects or any other animation tool for interactions
* Skilled in Cinema 4D or Blender


**Benefits**
* International work environment
* Competitive compensation package including wellness allowance, occupational pension, medical insurance, private health insurance, life insurance and work-injury insurance
* Five weeks of holiday per year
* Flexible work hours and hybrid work model
* Modern office space located in Epicenter (Hötorget)
* Access to all the latest Ubiquiti products and prototypes for home use and tests

title: Graphic Designer
description:
**Step into a world of opportunity.** 
  

 At Colliers, it’s not just our success that sets us apart but how we achieve it. Our people are
   

 passionate, take ownership, and always do what’s right for our clients, people, and communities.
   

  

**Why Colliers?** 
  

 Colliers is a leading and award-winning commercial real estate advisor in the Nordics and globally.
   

 Our overall transaction market share in the region is around 20%. Colliers’ advisory offering and
   

 value chain in the Nordic region includes capital markets, corporate finance, debt advisory,
   

 project finance, valuation/advisory, leasing, occupier services, and highly reputed research.
   

  





  

 We are now hiring a Graphic Designer
 **.** 
 The role will be based at the Stockholm office and report to the Head of Marketing and Communications Nordics based in Oslo.
   

  





 As a
 **Graphic Designer** 
 , you will help shape our visual brand identity, producing high-quality marketing materials, and collaborating with teams to bring creative ideas to life. Whether designing from scratch or improving existing materials, you’ll ensure all visuals support our brand and business goals.
   

  





 Our nimble, decentralized, and entrepreneurial culture offers a wealth of opportunities. Our team
   

 is experienced, highly skilled, and driven by a strong commitment to delivering exceptional
   

 results.
   

  





**Application details** 
  

 Please upload your CV using the link in the ad by April 15.
   

 Contact: Jennifer Sannebro | +46 73 07 944 68
   

  

  

  




**Job Description**

**What You’ll Do**



* Keep our brand consistent – Make sure all designs follow brand guidelines and support teams with design-related questions.
* Create engaging content – Work with the Head of MarCom to develop marketing materials for LinkedIn, presentations, and ads.
* Support different teams – Design branding for client projects and create materials in Adobe InDesign or PowerPoint.
* Bring fresh ideas – Help our marketing stand out with creative and impactful designs.
* Manage production – Handle multiple design projects while keeping quality and deadlines in check.
* Be a team player – Work with colleagues across departments to keep creativity and collaboration strong.
* Follow design and industry trends to keep Colliers Nordics looking modern and professional.
* Prioritize and align projects with the marketing team and business areas to ensure smooth execution.


**Qualifications**

**Who You Are**



* Experienced – 5+ years in graphic design.
* Flexible – Can switch between creative brainstorming and hands-on design work.
* Team-oriented – Work well with different teams and stakeholders.
* Strategic thinker – Understand how design influences marketing and engagement.
* Adaptable – Can adjust designs for different audiences and needs.
* Skilled in design tools – Proficient in Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, InDesign, Illustrator) and Microsoft PowerPoint. Bonus if you have motion graphics or video editing skills!
* Detail-focused – Strong skills in layout, typography, retouching, and color correction.
* Organized & efficient – Can manage multiple projects, meet deadlines, and work in a fast-paced environment.
* Marketing-savvy – Understand how design impacts performance across different platforms.


**Additional Information**

 This is a fixed-term employment covering paternity leave from June 2025 to January 2026.
   

  





 We also welcome applications from self-employed graphic designers interested in collaborating with us on a freelance basis.

title: Product Designer
description:
***This job is with EQT Group, an inclusive employer and a member of myGwork – the largest global platform for the LGBTQ+ business community. Please do not contact the recruiter directly.***
*Our vision for EQT employees is to build high performing & engaged teams. Our competitive edge comes from fostering an environment where every individual feels valued, empowered, and motivated to drive business impact.
   

  

 Our commitment to inclusion is not just about fairness; We understand and believe that being a great place to work drives the best performance.
   

  

 At EQT, inclusion is a business imperative and it's embedded into our talent strategy, decision-making, and culture to ensure that every individual and team operates at their full potential. By doing so, we unlock better collaboration, stronger innovation, and superior investment outcomes*
**Are you a Product Designer who wants to shape the future of decision-making in investment and business strategy?**
 Then this is your opportunity to work at the intersection of technology, data science, and design, solving complex challenges with innovative solutions.
   

  

 Come join us at
 **Motherbrain** 
 , EQT’s proprietary AI-driven investment platform, we’d love to hear from you!
   

  

**About Motherbrain**
 Motherbrain is EQT’s proprietary AI-driven investment platform, built to elevate decision-making in the private markets. The team integrates data science and machine learning into our investment strategy, offering a unique platform and opportunity to tackle complex, real-world challenges. We collaborate closely with EQT’s Investment Professionals to create data-driven insights that fuel smarter, faster, and more efficient investment decisions. This collaboration ensures that our innovative solutions significantly impact diverse sectors such as healthcare, technology, and infrastructure. Here, you'll discover an environment that fosters learning and growth, where your contributions influence tangible business outcomes and play a key role in EQT’s global strategy.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a
 **Product Designer at Motherbrain** 
 , you will be a key driver of the design discipline within our organization and the Motherbrain platform specifically. This role is critical in shaping the platform user experience, evolving our design strategy, and ensuring that our product meets both user and business needs.
   

  

 You will lead design initiatives across multiple work streams, collaborating closely with Product Managers, Engineers, Customer Success, as well as our users to create intuitive and impactful solutions.
   

  

 You will also play a key role in establishing best practices, fostering a strong design culture, and pushing the boundaries of AI-powered experiences to enhance decision-making within EQT.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* End-to-end design ownership: Take a holistic approach to design - driving discovery, user research, concept development, prototyping, user testing, and final UI design, ensuring a seamless transition from ideas to implementation
* Strategic impact: Shape and evolve the UX vision for Motherbrain, using data-driven insights to align design decisions with EQT’s business objectives and user needs while balancing complexity
* Communication & advocacy: Clearly articulate design rationale, challenge assumptions, and engage in productive discussions with stakeholders and cross-functional teams to drive better outcomes
* Collaboration: Work closely with Product, Engineering, Customer Success and other teams to ensure user-centered design is embedded throughout the product development process
* User research & validation: Conduct and synthesize user research to uncover insights, validate design decisions, and improve the usability and impact of our solutions
* Execution & delivery: Translate complex ideas into clear design solutions, balancing speed with quality to ensure high-impact results
* AI & innovation: Drive AI integration to enhance user decision-making with intuitive and effective designs


**About You**
 You are a strategic thinker with a strong passion for user experience and a deep understanding of how design can enhance decision-making. You thrive in a fast-paced, collaborative environment and are eager to work on AI-driven products.
   

  

**Required Qualifications**
* Broad UX/product design experience: 5+ years or equivalent seniority in designing complex digital products/platforms, with expertise across the full design lifecycle - from research and strategy to UX/UI design and implementation
* Strong communication & stakeholder management: Ability to advocate for design decisions, facilitate discussions, and navigate differing perspectives to drive alignment
* Collaboration & cross-disciplinary work: Experience working closely within as well as with other cross functional teams
* Proficiency in UX best practices: Strong understanding of UX principles, research methodologies and interaction design
* Ability to drive clarity: Skilled at making complex problems understandable and turning abstract concepts into actionable design solutions
* Curiosity & adaptability: Comfortable working in an evolving environment, with a passion for learning and improving both the design process and the product


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Experience designing products to internal users and stakeholders
* Experience with setting, driving and evaluating measuring success, as well as familiarity with related tools such as analytics tools and SQL
* Experience in prompt design
* Experience designing AI-powered or data-driven tools
* Experience working within the financial space


**What We Offer**
 At EQT, you’ll have the opportunity to
 **work at the forefront of AI and technology** 
 in investment decision-making. You’ll join a highly skilled, collaborative team and contribute to products that drive
 **real-world impact** 
 .
   

  

**We Offer**
* A dynamic, innovation-driven environment where you can grow and experiment
* The chance to shape the future of AI-elevated investing
* Competitive salary and opportunities for professional development
* A strong team culture that values curiosity, learning, and collaboration


**Inclusion at EQT**
 At EQT, we work proactively to create an inclusive and welcoming workplace where all employees feel valued and empowered. We strongly believe that
 **diverse teams drive better innovation and investment outcomes** 
 . We recruit, promote, and compensate based on merit, regardless of gender, ethnicity, religion, age, nationality, sexual orientation, disabilities, or background.
   

  

**About EQT**
 EQT is a purpose-driven global investment organization focused on active ownership strategies. With a Nordic heritage and a global mindset, EQT has a track record of almost three decades of developing companies across multiple geographies, sectors and strategies. EQT has investment strategies covering all phases of a business’ development, from start-up to maturity. EQT has EUR ‌ 246 billion in total assets under management (EUR ‌ ‌133 billion in fee-generating assets under management), within two business segments – Private Capital and Real Assets.
   

  

 With its roots in the Wallenberg family’s entrepreneurial mindset and philosophy of long-term ownership, EQT is guided by a set of strong values and a distinct corporate culture. EQT manages and advises funds and vehicles that invest across the world with the mission to future-proof companies, generate attractive returns and make a positive impact with everything EQT does.EQT has offices in more than 25 countries across Europe, Asia and the Americas and has more than 1,800 employees.
   

  

 More info: www.eqtgroup.com
   

  

 Follow EQT on LinkedIn, X, YouTube and Instagram

title: Graphic Designer
description:
**About Us:** 




 Hormona is a data-driven women’s health company, on a mission to revolutionize women’s health. Our award-winning app is the first comprehensive personalized hormone tracking app that helps women of all ages understand and optimize their individual cycle and hormone health. Through a wide range of popular features such as hormone, cycle, period, and symptom tracking, daily health insights, hormone education, dietary advice, and symptom-mitigating tips and plans, Hormona is pioneering the area of "Hormone Health" and cycle optimization.
 



  





**Who We’re Looking For:** 




 As a Graphic Designer at Hormona, you’ll play a key role in shaping our brand’s visual identity. From campaigns and product packaging to digital assets and paid social creatives, you’ll bring our vision to life across multiple touchpoints. Your work will be essential in defining Hormona’s brand evolution, ensuring that every design piece contributes to our mission and resonates with our audience.
 



  





 We’re looking for a strategic thinker with a strong creative instinct, a deep passion for design, and a results-driven mindset. You thrive in a fast-paced environment and aren’t afraid to take ownership, experiment, and push creative boundaries.
 



  





**Role Overview:** 




 As a Graphic Designer, you will lead the creative execution of Hormona’s branding, marketing, and product design efforts. Your role will involve conceptualizing, designing, and producing visually compelling assets that engage users, enhance brand perception, and drive growth.
 



  





 You’ll work closely with marketing, product, and content teams to ensure that all visual assets are aligned with Hormona’s brand identity and business objectives. Whether it’s crafting eye-catching social media content, developing campaign visuals, you’ll be instrumental in shaping how Hormona communicates with its audience.
 



  





 This is a unique opportunity to lead design at a fast-growing health tech company and make a real impact on the lives of millions of women worldwide.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities:** 



* Ideate, design, and produce a wide range of static and motion graphics primarily for social media, emails, and paid ads (Facebook, Instagram, TikTok, Snapchat, Pinterest, and more).
* Collaborate with the Marketing team to analyze creative performance and optimize assets for better engagement and conversion.
* Develop and evolve Hormona’s visual identity, ensuring consistency across all platforms.
* Work closely with Marketing to design and produce campaign visuals, branding materials, and digital assets.
* Execute multi-channel campaign rollouts across print, OOH, and digital platforms.
* Create digital assets for CRM, web, email, newsletters, and website content.
* Manage workload, deadlines, and project quality, ensuring high standards of execution.
* A big plus if you have photographic skills and enjoy taking and editing pictures.



  





**Qualifications:** 



* A visual style that aligns with Hormona’s brand, with a keen eye for detail and brand storytelling.
* 4+ years of experience in graphic design, ideally within beauty, wellness, or lifestyle industries.
* Deep understanding of social media best practices, emerging trends, and new creative technologies.
* Strong knowledge of how design impacts user experience and brand perception.
* Expertise in Adobe Creative Suite & Figma—experience with Premiere Pro, After Effects, or Final Cut is a plus.
* Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously while meeting deadlines.



  





**What We Offer You:** 




 😊 A friendly, curious, and international working environment with a small, ambitious team
 



 ⏰ Flexible working opportunities
 



 🤝 Impact the future of the company
 



 💼 Office space at Norrsken in Stockholm
 



 🌎 Fun meet-ups with the whole team around Europe
 



 ⭐️ Play a big role in our mission to improve the future of female health
 



 🌱 Growth opportunities
 



 💰 Competitive salary with the opportunity for options
 



  





 As a Graphic Designer at Hormona, you’ll have the unique opportunity to shape the visual identity of a pioneering health tech brand, create meaningful work that impacts millions of women, and contribute to the future of hormone health innovation.
 



  





 Join us and help transform women’s health through data-driven innovation and growth.

title: Lead Service Designer
description:
*Digital Customer Offering (DCO) is a business function within Fortum Consumer Solutions, where business and technology come together. At DCO, we create superior digital offerings and experiences for our 2,4 million consumer and enterprise customers. We innovate and find new ways to digitalize our offerings and processes. We collaborate closely with our stakeholders and external partners. Through cross-functional collaboration, agility and sustainability focus, we strive to make our customers’ increasingly digital lives easier with our services. We serve clients in the Nordics as well as Poland and Spain.*
 We are looking for a talented and passionate Lead Service Designer to join our newly formed Marketing Technology Solutions unit! This role is reporting to the Marketing Technology Solutions Director and supporting in various projects to enhance digital customer experience, digital marketing smartness, market-leading design, and user-friendliness. If you are fascinated by leading service design strategy across various projects in different markets, and fostering a collaborative and innovative work environment, we would love to hear from you!
   

  

**In this role, you will:**
* Lead the design vision and strategy across various projects, ensuring design and UX excellence.
* Design and iterate on our digital customer journeys, to ensure a smooth and efficient customer experience across relevant touch points.
* Contribute to developing the service design domain within the Marketing Technology Solutions.
* Support initiatives across customer journeys in Fortum Consumer Solutions, to ensure a professional and coherent experience in line with brand guidelines.
* Drive innovation and creative excellence within the service design function.
* Establish and enforce service design standards, processes, and best practices.
* Manage stakeholder expectations and communicate design goals and processes effectively.
* Stay up-to-date with industry trends and emerging technologies in service design.


 This position can be located in either Espoo, Solna, Göteborg, Kristiansand or Oslo. At Fortum, we apply a hybrid working model. Read more about other job opportunities, our projects and what we offer here!
   

  

**To excel in this role, you are expected to have:**
* Strong understanding of service design principles and methodologies.
* Proficiency in using tools for service design, such as journey mapping software.
* Strategic thinking and the ability to align service design with business goals.
* Bachelor's or Master's degree in Design or a related field.
* At least 5 years of design experience and a successful track record.
* Highly skilled in your own field and good knowledge of other design expertise areas.
* Experienced with agile and lean methodologies in a fast-paced environment.
* Committed to fostering a culture of continuous learning and professional growth within the design team.


**Ready to Join Us?**
 Don't miss out on this exciting opportunity! Submit your application by
 **20.3** 
 at the latest. If you have any questions or would like to learn more about the position, feel free to reach out via email to Tore Andre Godager, Director Markteting Technology Solutions at tore.andre.godager@fortum.com. We're here to help and look forward to hearing from you!
   

  

 We work with an ongoing selection and the job ad might be closed before the final application date.
   

  

 To be selected for the position, the applicant must go through background clearance and a health examination including drug testing.
   

  

**We are Fortum**
 Fortum is a Nordic energy company. Our purpose is to power a world where people, businesses and nature thrive together. We are one of the cleanest energy producers in Europe and our actions are guided by our ambitious environmental targets. We generate and deliver clean energy reliably and help industries to decarbonise their processes and grow. Our core operations in the Nordics comprise of efficient, CO2-free power generation as well as reliable supply of electricity and district heat to private and business customers. For our :5 000 employees, we commit to be a safe, and inspiring workplace. Fortum's share is listed on Nasdaq Helsinki. fortum.com

title: Web Editor and Content Creator (temporary employment)
description:
Om tjänsten
   

  

 How does building a new business for Vattenfall sound? Are you an experienced communicator and an expert in creating state of the art content? Are you a digital native who works data driven and always puts the customer first? If yes, the Vattenfall DES Nordic team – responsible for Vattenfall's solar, battery, and flexibility services – can offer an interesting opportunity to work with products and solutions that make a difference.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As Web Editor and Content Creator within the Nordic DES team, you will support the solar and battery business in business development projects and daily operational work.
   

  

* Web Editor: You will produce, analyze and improve content on the website, keeping SEO, CRO and potential A/B-tests in mind.
* Content Creator: You will help the daily, operational business with copywriting and design, creating and updating assets such as sales folders, order forms and confirmations, emails, newsletters and surveys.
* Communicator: You will assist in business development initiatives, creating customer-centric communication, appealing offers and comprehensible information based on business strategy and customer and market insights.


**As a person you need capabilities such as:**
* Creativity paired with attention to detail. You understand the possibilities and boundaries in brand guidelines.
* Capacity to work in a fast speeded and changing business area where priorities and tasks may change rapidly.
* Being structured and capable to work independently.
* A ‘’get things done’’-mentality, i.e. a pragmatic approach, an ability to think out of the box and deliver in time.
* Curiosity and the courage to suggest and argue for your own ideas and standpoints.
* Having a true team spirit.


 Din bakgrund
   

  

* Fluent in Swedish and English verbally and in writing. Finnish is meritorious.
* Academic degree within preferably digital communication or marketing and/or minimum 3 years relevant working experience
* Experience and proven track record as a communicator and/or web editor
* Understanding of SEO and accessibility guidelines
* Experience from working with:
* CMS and CRM systems (we use Episerver and Microsoft Dynamics)
* Adobe Creative Suite
* Web analysis tools such as Piwik Pro, Google Analytics, Matomo or similar
* SEO tools such as Ahrefs or similar


**Meritorious:**
* Previous work in the solar business or within a technical field
* Previous work in a large, complex organization
* Experience from agile way of working
* Customer surveys – planning, effectuation and analysis of results
* Experience/interest in UX design
* Experience in working with email marketing
* Marketing automation knowledge


 Mer information
   

  

**Our Offer**
 We offer a challenging and international work environment and the possibility to work with some of the best in the field. You will be working in interdisciplinary teams and you can always count on support from committed colleagues as ‘Ask and Share’ concept is essential for the way we work. We offer attractive employment conditions (smart working, flexible working hours and a good-work-life balance) and opportunities for personal and professional development. Click here for further information.
   

  

**Position** 
 : Temporary 8 month employment
   

  

**Location** 
 : Solna, Sweden. 40 % work place flexibility, 60 % office presence required.
   

  

 We welcome your application in English, via the application button on this page.
 **Last day to apply is 30/3.** 
 Please apply only with your CV, we do not accept Cover Letters. Selection and interviews will take place after the application deadline. We only accept applications through our website.
   

  

 For more information about the position, please contact the hiring manager Maria Juhlin-Hoff at maria.juhlin-hoff@vattenfall.com. If you have questions regarding the recruitment process, please contact recruiter Elisabeth Hagman at Elisabeth.hagman@vattenfall.com.
   

  

 Trade Union representatives in Sweden via Vattenfall´s switchboard +46 8 739 50 00. Rolf Olsson (Akademikerna), Simon Salomonsson (Unionen), Cecilia Bodin (Ledarna), Mikael Mukka (SEKO)
   

  

 At Vattenfall we are convinced that diversity contributes to build a more profitable and attractive company and we strive to be a good role model regarding diversity. Vattenfall works actively for all employees to have the same opportunities and rights regardless of gender, ethnicity, age, transgender identity or expression, religion or other belief, disability or sexual orientation. Click here for further information.
   

  

 The security of Vattenfall and its employees is essential. For that reason, a pre-employment screening will be part of your recruitment process. The screening is based on the role you will fulfill within Vattenfall.
   

  

 Since Vattenfall is a part of the Swedish critical infrastructure, many of our services are security classed. If this position is security classed the final candidates might be subjected to a security vetting process, according to the Swedish legislation.
   

  

 We look forward to receiving your application!
   

  

 Om oss
   

  

 Vattenfall is one of Europe’s largest producers and retailers of electricity and heat. Our main markets are Sweden, Germany, the Netherlands, Denmark, and the UK. The Vattenfall Group has approximately 21 000 employees. We have been electrifying industries, powering homes and transforming life through innovation for more than 100 years.

title: Graphic Designer
company_industry: Online and Mail Order Retail, Retail Apparel and Fashion, and Wholesale
description:
*Är du en passionerad och driven grafisk designer med känsla för kommersiell design? Vill du vara med och forma ett av Sveriges mest spännande varumärken inom doft och skönhet i en roll där du får stort kreativt utrymme? Nu har du möjligheten att få bli en del av ett ambitiöst företag i tillväxt och ett innovativt team som har riktigt kul ihop!* 




  





 Vår kund Parfym.se söker en erfaren, kreativ och handlingskraftig Grafisk Designer som vill ta varumärkets visuella uttryck till nästa nivå. E-Commerce Recruit hanterar denna rekryteringsprocess men anställning sker direkt hos Parfym.se.
 



  





**Om rollen** 




 I denna roll kommer du att vara en nyckelspelare i marknadsteamet och arbeta både strategiskt och operativt för att skapa kreativa koncept och material som stärker parfym.se:s varumärke och driver försäljning i tre olika marknader inklusive alla digitala ytor samt två fysiska butiker. Vi ser dig som en kreativ idéspruta med ett skarpt öga för detaljer och en förmåga att snabbt omsätta idéer till visuellt tilltalande material i olika format. Vi tror att du ser dig själv som en strateg med fingertoppkänsla för varumärkesbyggande och en handlingskraftig doer – en person som ser möjligheter och gör dem till verklighet.
 



  





 Dina huvudsakliga ansvarsområden:
 


* Vidareutveckla och säkerställa implementering av den nya varumärkesidentiteten på ett konsekvent sätt i alla kanaler och marknader.
* Leda skapandet och produktionen av kampanjkoncept och anpassa dem för olika format och medier.
* Producera digitalt kampanjmaterial som exempelvis banners, material för sociala medier, nyhetsbrev samt fysiska butiker och utomhusreklam.
* Lösa uppgifter Ad-hoc.
* Bygga och hantera en asset bank med foto- och videoresurser.
* Implementera den nya grafiska identiteten i merchandise, presentationer och PR-material.
* Trendspaning och omvärldsbevakning – hålla koll på branschen och identifiera nya visuella möjligheter.
* Skapa fotobriefs och moodboards för kampanjer och produktfotograferingar.



  





**Din bakgrund** 




 Vi söker dig som är både kreativ och strategiskt lagd – du älskar att skapa, men har även ett starkt kommersiellt tänk och kan se helheten när det kommer till verksamhetens tillväxtmål.
 



 Vidare är du ansvarstagande, resultatorienterad och lösningsfokuserad – du är en person som ser möjligheter, tar initiativ och får saker gjorda.
 



 För att trivas i rollen och organisationen behöver du vara snabbrörlig och flexibel, du trivs i ett högt tempo och kan hantera både planerade och ad hoc-projekt.
 



 Du har en genuin passion för design och varumärkesutveckling samt förstår hur visuellt innehåll kan driva försäljning. Du är en prestigelös och positiv person med förmåga att driva ditt eget arbete samt gillar att samarbeta och dela idéer med andra.
 



  





 Kvalifikationer:
 


* Minst 3 års erfarenhet av en liknande roll, gärna inom e-handel.
* Erfarenhet av varumärkesutveckling och digital marknadsföring.
* Starka kunskaper i Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, InDesign, Illustrator, After Effects).
* Grundläggande förståelse för SEO, CRM och digital annonsering.
* Flytande i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift.



  





 Meriterande kunskaper (inte krav)
 


* Kunskaper inom fotografi eller UX
* Motion graphics
* AI Design
* Copywriting



  





**Parfym.se erbjuder** 



* Ett engagerat och familjärt team som brinner för att skapa något unikt tillsammans.
* En energifylld, snabbrörlig och entreprenöriell miljö där du får stort kreativt utrymme.
* Möjlighet att påverka och ta ägarskap över det visuella uttrycket för ett växande varumärke.
* En inspirerande bransch där skönhet, estetik och kreativitet står i centrum.
* Möjlighet att arbeta med inspirerande varumärken och andra kreatörer



  





**Placering & start** 




 Tjänsten är på heltid med placering på kontor i centrala Stockholm. Flexibilitet erbjuds när det kommer till distansarbete några dagar i veckan.
 



 Start i augusti enligt överenskommelse.
 



  





**Kontakt & ansökan** 




 Urval och intervjuer sker löpande, därför ber vi dig att inte vänta med din ansökan!
 



 Personligt brev är inte ett krav i denna process men gärna ett utförligt cv och länk till arbetsprover/portfolio.
 



  





 Vid eventuella frågor och funderingar är du välkommen att kontakta ansvarig rekryterare Axel Stark, tel.0733770768, mail: axel@ecommercerecruit.se

title: Growth Manager
description:
**Join a Dynamic Enterprise Spearheading Innovations in the Storage Sector** 




  






 Are you ready to be at the forefront of transforming the real estate industry? As one of the first hires at our company, founded by serial entrepreneurs, you have a unique opportunity to shape a major international business that challenges the traditional storage category. We offer a role where your contributions will have a direct impact on our growth and innovation as we expand across Europe.
 




  





**About the Role** 





 As our Growth Manager, you will independently drive our digital and physical marketing strategies, enhancing our market presence and customer acquisition. Your primary responsibility will be to develop and implement innovative marketing tactics using technology tools and data-driven insights. You will manage the full spectrum of our marketing activities, from content creation, SEO/SEM to our design and our international brand presence.
 




  





***Key responsibilities include:***



* Devising and executing comprehensive, repeatable, and profitable digital marketing campaigns.
* Define, measure, and act on relevant growth KPIs (CAC, LTV, conversion etc)
* Creating and maintaining robust customer acquisition funnels through innovative use of technology.
* Create and implement launch campaigns, both digital and physical for each new site opening.
* Employing advanced analytics to refine marketing strategies and enhance user engagement.
* Leading the development and management of our website (and potential apps) and ensuring an intuitive user experience that aligns with visual design principles.
* Acting as the primary catalyst for our marketing initiatives, ensuring projects transition smoothly from concept to execution without reliance on external teams.



  





**We are looking for someone with** 



* 3-5 years of experience in a marketing or growth management role, preferably within a tech-focused environment.
* A solid track record in delivering measurable results in SEO, SEM, and online brand building.
* Creative thinking in terms of budgets and execution tactics.
* Proficiency in leveraging UI/UX principles to enhance customer interactions.
* A proactive and autonomous approach to workplace challenges.
* Strong ability to adapt and innovate under pressure.
* Excellent communication skills in multiple languages, with Swedish and English being essential.



  






 Join us to be at the forefront of redefining storage solutions and directly impact our strategic direction and operational success. Your expertise will not only drive our marketing efforts but also shape the future of storage solutions in the housing market.
 




  





**More About Us** 





 Henriksson is a self-storage company with a bold vision. As the demand for flexible, secure, and affordable storage solutions increases, we see a unique opportunity to fill the gap in the market. With fewer housing developments offering integrated storage solutions, our mission is to provide individuals and businesses with a cost-effective alternative. We are growing quickly across Europe, and we’re looking for passionate individuals to join us on this exciting journey.
 




  






 If you are ready to take on a challenging and rewarding role in a fast-growing company, we would love to hear from you. Please send your application and any questions you might have to careers@henriksson.com.

title: Senior Product Designer
job_function: Design, Product Management, and Information Technology
description:
**About Us** 




  





**At Kindred, we don't just follow the game, we reinvent it.** 




 Kindred is one of Europe’s leading betting and gaming operators, with a vast portfolio of iconic brands and a reputation for technological excellence. With more than 5,000 employees and a presence in around fifteen regulated markets, the Group offers a diversified, responsible range of games, both under exclusive rights and open to competition. We set new standards, proving that entertainment and safety can go hand in hand. Here, you’ll work alongside a team of passionate individuals dedicated to delivering the best and safest entertaining experiences for our customers every day.
 



  





 We’re looking for bold people who are eager to succeed and ready to level-up the game. If you thrive on innovation, embrace challenges, and want to make a real impact at all levels, Kindred is your playing field.
 



**Join us in shaping the future of gaming. Are you ready to LEVEL-UP THE GAME?** 




  





**The role** 




 We're looking for a Senior Product Designer who can build engaging experiences to join our Sportsbook Product design team here at Kindred! As a Product Designer, you will be an essential member of both the Sportsbook Design team and a dedicated cross-functional team alongside Product Manager/Owner and Developers. In this role, you'll ensure that outcomes are insight-driven, thoughtfully explored, and aligned with our design process.
 



  





 We are home to several successful online gambling brands, with Unibet being our largest Sportsbook brand. As part of our team, you'll work across international products, crafting experiences that impact millions of sports betting enthusiasts worldwide.
 



  





 You will play a central role in developing a key area of our overall user experience, driving the creation of innovative and user-centered design solutions that enhance usability and engagement. Your expertise will be crucial in translating complex ideas into intuitive interfaces that resonate with our users, ultimately shaping how they interact with our products.
 



  





 As a multi-location team, we balance working from home and the office. With part of the design team based outside Europe, some flexibility in working hours is needed to collaborate effectively across time zones. If you're looking to join a collaborative team where every voice is heard and contributions are valued, we encourage you to apply.
 



  





**What you will do** 



* Gather data, insights, and requirements to make evidence-based decisions.
* Design UX architecture and UI for a cohesive user experience across platforms.
* Deliver high-quality user flows, concepts, prototypes, and design documentation.
* Contribute to defining visions that balanceuser needs and business goals.
* Collaborate with your design team and wider community to transform ideas into useful features and multi-channel experiences.
* Work closely with Product Designers, UX Researchers, Product Owners and Developers.
* Craft easy to use, accessible, and modular designs that can scale to millions of users.
* Present outcomes clearly using storytelling techniques for various stakeholders.
* Build strong relationships and trust, ensuring we get the best from both our team members and those we work closely with.



  





**Your experience** 



* Proven experience in Product Design, creating impactful user experiences across various platforms and channels with an app-first mindset.
* A strong capability to make pragmatic design decisions aligned with business goals and user needs.
* Expert knowledge of Figma , including its core features such as auto-layout, component variants, and libraries
* Ability to provide and receive actionable feedback from UX experts, stakeholders, and developers
* Natural collaborator who thrives in diverse, complex, and changing environments.
* Effective communicator with storytelling skills to articulate design decisions rationale.
* A track record of delivering high-quality design work.
* Passion for sports and basic knowledge of the filed is a plus



  





**Our Way Of Working** 




 Our world is hybrid.
 



 A career is not a sprint. It’s a marathon. One of the perks of joining us is that we value you as a person first. Our hybrid world allows you to focus on your goals and responsibilities and lets you self-organise to improve your deliveries and get the work done in your own way.
 



  





**Application Process** 




 We believe talent knows no boundaries. Our hiring process focuses solely on your skills, experience, and potential to contribute to our team. We welcome applicants from all backgrounds and evaluate each candidate based on merit, regardless of personal characteristics as the age, gender, origin, religion, sexual orientation, neurodiversity or disability.

title: Projektledare/Digital Produktägare i Stockholm
description:
**Just nu söker vi konsulter till hösten 2025. Vi är öppna för dialog om tidigare anställning givet att vi gemensamt kan säkra ett uppdrag tidigare.**
**Om oss**
 B3 Business Transformation är ett av Sveriges ledande konsultföretag inom digitalisering och förändringsarbete. Vi brinner för att skapa värde för våra kunder genom att leda komplexa projekt och utveckla nya arbetssätt. Vi fortsätter att växa och söker nu erfarna konsulter till vårt team med projektledare och strateger. Vill du utvecklas och inspireras i en miljö med erfarna, trevliga och prestigelösa kollegor i spännande uppdrag? Vi försöker leva som vi lär genom att kultur, utveckling och samarbete i teamet och bolaget med ett agilt och självorganiserande mindset som baseras på nyfikenhet, lust och utbyte av erfarenheter.
   

  

**Vad vi erbjuder**
 Som en del av vårt team får du tillgång till en dynamisk arbetsplats där din utveckling står i fokus. Vi erbjuder kompetensutveckling med tillgång till branschledande utbildningar och certifieringar. Du får möjlighet till spännande och varierande uppdrag i både privat och offentlig sektor. Vår arbetskultur präglas av öppenhet, samarbete och ambition att ligga i framkant. Du får också möjlighet att påverka och bidra till långsiktig förändring hos några av Sveriges mest intressanta organisationer.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 Som konsult hos oss kommer du arbeta med både mindre och större komplexa uppdrag hos välkända kunder.
   

  

 Som projektledare arbetar du med att stötta kunders förändringsarbete - från strategi hela vägen till ett förändrat beteende och nya eller förbättrade IT-stöd. Du arbetar ofta med ledningen hos våra kunder för att ta fram tydliga beslutsunderlag och roadmaps för genomförande och du coachar organisationen i införande av nya arbetssätt.
   

  

 Som digital produktägare kommer du arbeta med både mindre och större komplexa projekt eller agila strömmar hos välkända kunder. Du får ta ansvar för att leverera meningsfulla och hållbara digitala produkter utifrån agila arbetssätt, användarcentrering samt data- och AI-drivet. Det handlar främst om initiativ som syftar till att utveckla det digitala kundmötet och se till att processer och system finns på baksidan stödjer förflyttningen. Ofta ingår även i uppdragen att stötta kundens organisation och leda förändring mot att jobba effektivt och modernt med agila metoder för att hantera vision, roadmap, backlog etc, samt i olika utsträckning även hantera kommersiella och affärsutvecklingsfrågor.
   

  

 Utöver rollerna ovan tror vi du kan ta någon eller några av rollerna som programledare, kravanalytiker, scrum Master, verksamhetsutvecklare eller andra liknande roller.
   

  

**Om dig**
 Vi är erfarna konsulter med bred branscherfarenhet och har vana av förändringsarbete genom digitalisering. Vi söker dig som har liknande erfarenheter som konsult och minst 5 års erfarenhet av digitala förändringsprojekt och en stark förståelse för hur digitalisering kan stärka affären och möjliggöra nya arbetssätt. Du vill vara aktiv och delaktig i den fortsatta utvecklingen av B3 Business Transformation och kan proaktivt vara med och bygga våra egna nätverk som bidrar till nya affärer och relationer. Vidare har du erfarenhet av att arbeta såväl strategiskt, taktiskt som operativt.
   

  

 I rollen som Projektledare ser vi gärna att du:
   

  

* Tar ansvar för arbetet kring organisation, roller, arbetssätt, styrning och kultur i större digitaliserings- och IT-projekt
* Intar rådgivarrollen och är trygga med att såväl utmana som stötta så väl ledningspersoner och verksamhet, samt har god förståelse av vad konsultmässighet innebär
* Har erfarenhet av att driva projekt från strategi till förvaltning


 I rollen som Digital Produktägare ser vi gärna att du har:
   

  

* Erfarenhet av att leda agila digitala projekt och/eller agila produktteam som exempelvis större webbprojekt, digital självservice, digital försäljning/growth eller implementering av CRM
* En god förståelse för det digitala kundmötet, affär, design/UX, teknik och moderna agila arbetssätt


**Det är toppen om du även har erfarenhet av**
* Någon eller några verksamheter inom medlemsorganisationer, kommunal verksamhet, offentlig sektor, logistik, retail, återvinning och hållbarhetsområdet eller försvar
* Har relevanta certifieringar inom områden som SAFe, Prosci Change Management och andra specifika områden
* Produkter eller sammanhang där traditionell och/eller generativ AI har varit en del

title: Scrum Master / Tjänsteområdesansvarig Webb
description:
Vi söker nu förstärkning till vårt team inom Digital förvaltning och utveckling av Riksbyggens digitala kanaler.
   

  

 I rollen som Scrum Master/Tjänsteområdesansvarig kommer du att vara en nyckelperson i vårt arbete med att förbättra och optimera våra kundrelationer. Du kommer att arbeta med att leda utveckling och förvaltning av våra webbplatser, samt bidra till att skapa effektiva lösningar som stödjer vår verksamhet och våra kunders behov.
   

  

 Vi söker dig som har erfarenhet av system- och tjänsteutveckling inom Microsoft, agil systemutveckling och som brinner för att skapa värde genom teknik. Våra webbplatser är använder Optimizely som content managementsystem (CMS) men underliggande tjänster är till stor del byggda med Microsoft produktplattform. Hos oss får du möjlighet att vara delaktig i spännande projekt och att arbeta i en miljö där din kompetens och dina idéer värderas.
   

  

**Hos oss gör du skillnad** 
  

  

 I rollen som Scrum Master/Tjänsteområdesansvarig driver och håller du ihop utvecklingsaktiviteter av nya eller vidareutvecklade tjänster. Du kommer också att ha ett tjänsteansvar för de utvecklade lösningarna. Du behöver ha hög kompetens inom utveckling för att kunna kvalitetssäkra utvecklarnas arbete, ta löpande beslut och vägleda, och möjlighet att själv kunna delta i utvecklingen.
   

  

 Som Scrum Master/Tjänsteområdesansvarig har du det tekniska ledarskapet för utvecklingsaktiviteter. Du agerar som Scrum Master i den agila utvecklingsprocessen enligt SAFe metodik. Du kommer bl. a. arbeta med UX, systemdesign och utveckling på både operativ och taktisk nivå.
   

  

 Du kommer att driva det dagliga arbetet framåt med stort fokus på leverans och uppföljning av från verksamheten prioriterade förvaltnings- och utvecklingsaktiviteter mot beslutad budget. Du kommer jobba med Optimizely, egenutvecklade komponenter och en integrerad systemkarta.
   

  

 Du jobbar nära andra tjänsteområdesansvariga då utveckling ibland har beroenden och behöver samplaneras. Du ingår i gruppen Digital Utveckling och Förvaltning och rapporterar till Riksbyggens Digitaliseringschef men kommer även samarbeta med ansvarig för vår digitala plattform byggd i Azure samt ansvarig för digitala produkter. Rollen kräver också mycket samarbete med kommunikation och marknadsavdelningen som är innehållsansvarig för webbplatserna och bidrar i UX-arbete.
   

  

 I dina arbetsuppgifter ingår att:
   

  

* Utveckla och implementera lösningar som möter företagets mål och krav
* Samarbeta med andra avdelningar för att stödja företagets övergripande mål och strategier
* Arbeta enligt den agila metoden SAFe (Scaled Agile Framework)
* Leda och fördela arbete till utvecklare som jobbar i Tjänsteområdet (4-8 utvecklare)
* Samverka med övriga IT-team för att säkerställa en integrerad och effektiv IT-miljö
* Övergripande tekniskt supportansvar inom tjänsteansvaret
* Dokumentera processer och lösningar för att säkerställa tydlighet och kontinuitet


**Du bidrar med din kompetens och ditt engagemang**
 Vi söker dig som har god social förmåga, är kommunikativ och lyhörd i dialogen med verksamheten för att ta fram affärsmässiga och relevanta lösningsförslag utifrån deras behov.  Du kan diskutera frågeställningar och motivera val av lösning, både med tekniska specialister och personer utan teknisk kunskap.
   

  

 Du är en engagerad och förtroendeingivande person med en välutvecklad samarbetsförmåga, som är trygg i din kompetens och vill bidra till Riksbyggens framgång. Du är affärsdriven, målinriktad och trivs i en roll där du har förståelse för tekniken, och är drivande för att skapa nytta för kunden och våra medarbetare. Du har helhetssyn och förmåga att omsätta verksamhetsarkitekturen till hållbara tekniska lösningar.
   

  

**Kravprofil**
* Adekvat utbildning från universitet eller högskola, gärna inom IT och datavetenskap och minst 5 års relevant arbetslivserfarenhet
* Goda kunskaper i utvecklingsprocesser. Kunskap om utvecklingsverktyg och annan teknik så som databas, utvecklingsramverk, tredjeparts-produkter med mera
* God erfarenhet av utveckling i Optimizely
* God kunskap micro services
* Erfarenhet av att driva utvecklingsprojekt (från kravinsamling till färdig produkt)
* Stor förståelse kring agila arbetsmetoder (SAFe)
* En naturlig förmåga att vara strukturerad och organiserad och samtidigt klarar av snabba förändringar.


**Meriterande**
* Erfarenhet av Microsoft Dynamics 365 och andra affärssystem/ekonomisystem
* Erfarenhet av it-projektledning
* Erfarenhet från fastighetsbranschen


**Om Tjänsten**
 Tjänsten är tills vidare med placering på huvudkontoret på Kungsbron i Stockholm. Att kunna kommunicera väl på svenska, både i tal och skrift är en förutsättning för denna tjänst då svenska är koncernspråk. Riksbyggen strävar efter en jämn könsfördelning och ser mångfald som en styrka. Riksbyggen kan tillämpa provanställning.
   

  

 Du delar Riksbyggens grundläggande värderingar och kooperativa värdegrund som bygger på samhällsutveckling, att sätta människan i centrum och att verka för en hållbar utveckling.
   

  

**Ansökan och kontakt**
 Din ansökan skickar du till oss senast 2025-03-23. Urval sker löpande och tillsättning av tjänsten kan ske innan ansökningstiden har gått ut. Vid frågor kontakta Anna Rosen, anna.rosen@riksbyggen.se
   

  

 Klicka på länken om du är nyfiken på Riksbyggen. Är du nyfiken på hur det är hos oss? Till rekryteringskonsulter, annonssäljare etc. Vi har redan beslutat vilka vi samarbetar med vid rekryteringar samt var vi vill synas. Vi undanber oss därför kontakt från försäljare i dessa frågor.

title: IT Business and System Analyst
description:
Scania is undergoing a transformation from being a leading supplier of trucks, buses, and engines to providing complete and sustainable transport solutions. Together with TRATON and our sister brands MAN, Volkswagen Truck & Bus, and International, we are working to shape the future of mobility with innovative and environmentally conscious solutions. Our values – customer first, respect, team spirit, responsibility, and elimination of waste – are at the heart of everything we do. Together, we are at the forefront of creating a sustainable future.
   

  

 Are you passionate about software development and creating value that makes a difference? Do you want to be at the centre of Scania’s unique modular system that enables an extremely wide portfolio of products using relatively few components and parts? Do you want to work in a multifaceted, complex, continually changing environment and take your skills to the next level? Then you are reading the right ad!
   

  

**Role Summary**
 Our awesome Value Creation Team (VCT) is looking for a Business Analyst keen on learning about and working with our unique in-house developed Product Data Management system.
   

  

**The Value Creation Team**
 We follow a Lean-Agile framework inspired by SAFe, with about 100 members including Product Owners, Business Analysts, Architects, Developers, and Testers. In this role, you will work with PDM system users in Group R&D EE Applications and Platform, along with your team, to provide value to users, stakeholders, and TRATON’s customers.
   

  

**Job Responsibilities**
* Understand business and customer needs for requirement analysis and evaluate business processes from end-to-end to anticipate requirements and identify improvements.
* Knowledge of EE development is beneficial but not required.
* Break down complex requirements and find synergies in process design and implementation while collaborating with stakeholders, architects, developers, testers, and UX specialists through meetings and presentations.
* Ensure solutions meet business needs and align with requirements. Organise and guide users in acceptance testing.
* Improve internal processes to develop your team, domain, and PDM VCT.


**Who You Are**
 You enjoy working in a diverse, agile, team-based environment with lean principles and a strong customer and user focus. You are a humble and flexible team player, and you contribute to a good working atmosphere while focusing on continuous deliveries.
   

  

 We would also like that:
   

  

  

* You have a bachelor’s or master’s degree in IT, business management, or equivalent.
* You have at least 5 years’ experience in a business analysis-related role in a PDM context or/and EE Development.
* You have experience with process modelling, information flow modelling, and other methods of documenting system functions.
* You have worked with product description methodology, product structures, and change management.
* You write and speak English fluently. If you write and speak Swedish and/or German fluently it is considered a merit.


 At Scania, we are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive, and authentic workplace, so if you’re excited about this role but your experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles. We hire for attitude and train for skills!
   

  

 We welcome applicants from all backgrounds – your unique experience and perspectives is valuable to us.
   

  

**This Is Us**
 We thrive when we can solve problems and produce results together, drawing on each other’s strengths and helping if things don’t go as planned. Transparency, integrity, flexibility, and empathy are a few examples of values we live by.
   

  

 We offer you an interesting, fun, challenging, and developing journey with passionate colleagues in business and IT. Our Value Creation Team is involved in many strategic initiatives. The work environment is international, and your colleagues and stakeholders represent different nationalities and companies. As we are growing to support all brands from the TRATON Group in Sweden, Germany, USA, China and Latin America.
   

  

**Scania Offers**
 We offer a dynamic, flexible workplace with hybrid work options, including Scania Sergel and Midway hubs. With a structured development plan and courses, Scania supports your career growth both locally and internationally.
   

  

 Benefits include training at our health center Gröndal or wellness allowance, result bonus, flexible hours, and company car leasing. Scania also hosts events for employees and their families, and Stockholm residents enjoy direct access to Södertälje via Scania Job express buses.
   

  

**Application**
 Your application should include a CV, personal letter and any relevant certificates. We welcome all applicants and strive for diversity in our recruitment processes.
   

  

 Apply as soon as possible, no later than 2025-03-30. Screening will take place on an ongoing basis during the application period. Logical and personality tests may be used as part of the selection process, and a background check may be required for this role.
   

  

 If you have questions or would like more information, please contact:
   

  

 Philipp Lindemann, Group manager PDM Processes & Systems, at +46 7 214 526 11.
   

  

**We look forward to your application!**

title: Projektledare
description:
*Triggerfish och Awave går samman och bilder en gemensam framtida digital byrå under iO:s flagg. Med en stark närvaro inom webb och digitala lösningar söker vi nu dig – en affärsdriven webbprojektledare med kundansvar – som vill vara en del av vår fortsatta resa.* 




  





**Om rollen:** 




 Vi söker dig som är både kreativ och strukturerad – en projektledare med affärssinne och teknisk förståelse som vill hjälpa våra kunder att utveckla sin digitala närvaro. Hos oss får du en central roll i ett av våra kundteam, där du är med från första kontakt med kund, till färdig leverans och vidareutveckling av affären. Du får ansvar för befintliga, långsiktiga kunder samt nya i både mindre och större projekt. Du fungerar som en viktig länk mellan kunden, utvecklare, designers, strateger och säkerställer att alla projekt drivs framåt med struktur och tydlighet. Även om rollen innebär stort eget ansvar, är du aldrig ensam. Vi samarbetar tätt över avdelningarna för att optimera både vårt arbete och kundens upplevelse.
 



  





**Vi söker dig som…** 




 … är en erfaren projektledare från byråvärlden med en passion för webb, teknik och kundrelationer. Du navigerar tryggt i en föränderlig miljö och ser möjligheter i varje utmaning. För att trivas och lyckas i rollen ser vi att du har:
 


* 7+ års erfarenhet av digital projektledning (gärna med agil inriktning)
* Tidigare erfarenhet på webb-, reklam-, digitalbyrå eller konsultbolag
* Erfarenhet av att driva komplexa och mångfacetterade projekt
* Erfaren i att arbeta med kravställning, estimering, offerering samt hantera budget och fakturering
* God teknisk förståelse/kunskap tar dig närmare jobbet
* Strategisk förståelse för UX, teknik och affärsutveckling
* Flytande svenska och engelska
* Kunskaper i WordPress, Optimizely eller .NET är ett plus
* Boende i Stockholm, och jobbar delar av veckan på kontoret



  





**Triggerfish Awave part of iO** 




 Triggerfish och Awave är två etablerade digitala byråer som har gått samman och under hösten 2023 blev vi en del av den europeiska digitalkoncernen, iO. Våra systerbyråer i Norden finns i Göteborg och i Köpenhamn och iO grundades i BeNelux där det finns ett 20 tal digitala byråer. Vi är ett team på ca 75 medarbetare – projektledare, utvecklare, designers och digitala marknadsförare – som tillsammans skapar skräddarsydda digitala lösningar för våra kunder. Från strategi och design till utveckling och digital marknadsföring, tar vi ett helhetsgrepp om den digitala närvaron och strävar efter långsiktiga och hjärtliga kundrelationer.
 



  





**Är du vår nästa projektledare?** 




 Vi ser fram emot att välkomna en ny kollega som vill vara med och skapa digitala lösningar i framkant! Skicka in din ansökan redan idag – urval sker löpande, så vänta inte för länge. Vi hörs!
 



  





**START** 
 : Enligt överenskommelse
 



**PLATS** 
 : Regeringsgatan 109, Stockholm
 



**OMFATTNING** 
 : Heltid
 



**LÖN** 
 : Fast lön
 



**KONTAKT** 
 : Senior Talent Manager Mikaela Ehk,
 **mikaela.ehk@oddwork.se** 
 (för frågor om tjänsten, ej ansökningar)
 



**SISTA ANSÖKNINGSDATUM** 
 : Urval sker löpande
 



  





 This recruitment process is powered by Teamtailor on behalf of Oddwork. By applying for this role, you confirm that we store your personal data to be able to process the job application. Follow the link to read the Privacy Policy and learn more about what type of personal information we collect and how we use and protect such information: jobb.oddwork.se/pages/teamtailor-gdpr

title: Frontend Engineer - Svea Solar
description:
Svea Solar är ett av Europas snabbast växande energy-tech-bolag med över 50 000 installationer och mer än 10 års erfarenhet i branschen. Vårt erbjudande kombinerar smart mjuk- och hårdvara och skapar värde för privatpersoner, bolag och industriella solparker.
   

  

 Vi vill befria planeten från fossila bränslen och för att nå dit jobbar vårt webbteam på att hjälpa våra kunder att bli en del av energiomställningen. Vi har precis lanserat vår nya site och nu växlar vi upp ytterligare – därför söker vi en Frontend Engineer!
   

  

**Rollen**
 Som Frontend Engineer hos oss blir du en del av vårt ambitiösa och agila webbteam, där du utvecklar tekniska lösningar för Svea Solars webbplats. Du kommer även att arbeta nära vår övriga tech-avdelning för att säkerställa en sömlös upplevelse mellan vår site och Svea Solars smarta energiplattform ”Sunbeam”. Teamets roll växer i betydelse och siten får en allt mer central roll i vår affärsmodell.
   

  

 Vårt webbteam har ett starkt affärsfokus och är en del av marknadsavdelningen – en spännande set-up som gör att vi kan arbeta nära affären med korta beslutsvägar och iterativa utvecklingscykler. Det är via siten som vi får in nya kunder och hjälper dem att förstå hur de kan vara en del av den gröna omställning som bolaget bidrar till.
   

  

 I rollen rapporterar du till Oscar som är chef över webb-teamet.
   

  

**Är vi en match?**
 För att trivas på Svea Solar tror vi att du har ett starkt tekniskt intresse och att dina värderingar stämmer väl överens med våra. Vi söker dig som brinner för frontend-utveckling, snygg design, smarta tekniska lösningar och som trivs i en snabb och dynamisk miljö i en enormt spännande bransch. På Svea Solar har vi en "Collaboration-first"-mentalitet vilket är anledningen till att vi arbetar minst tre dagar i veckan på kontoret för att dela idéer och säkerställa gott samarbete mellan teamen.
   

  

**För att lyckas i rollen ser vi att du:**
* Har jobbat heltid i en liknande roll i minst 3 år
* Har en relevant examen från högskola eller universitet
* Är en stjärna på React.js och TypeScript – kan skriva läsbar, underhållbar och välformaterad kod och kan presentera exempel på det
* Är van vid att jobba nära UX/UI-designers och har ”ett öga” för funktionell och övertygande design (gärna om du har en portfolio att visa upp)
* Har jobbat med HTML5 och kan presentera exempel på det – förmåga att skriva semantiskt korrekt kod med fokus på tillgänglighet
* Har jobbat med CSS3 –  SASS eller liknande preprocessor och kan presentera exempel på det
* Talar och skriver flytande svenska och engelska (vår site är främst på svenska)


**Det Är Meriterande Om Du Även Har Arbetslivserfarenhet Av**
* Frontend: Next.js, Motion, Tailwind, Styled-components, i18next
* CMS och backend: Python, Django, Wagtail


 Så – tycker du om att bygga snygg frontend och vill vara med i den största energiomställningen i modern tid – skicka in din ansökan så snart som möjligt! Urval sker löpande så vänta inte!
   

  

**Vad vi erbjuder**
**Svea Solar – mer än solpaneler**
 Svea Solar är inte bara ledande inom solpanelsinstallationer och batterier, utan vi strävar efter att vara en långsiktig energipartner för våra kunder. Tillsammans med IKEA och andra samarbetspartners erbjuder vi en kurerad produktportfölj med smarta lösningar som gör det möjligt för våra kunder att producera, lagra och konsumera energi på ett kostnadseffektivt sätt. Vi arbetar ständigt för att utveckla nya lösningar som gör skillnad – både för våra kunder och för klimatet.
   

  

**Mångfald & inkludering**
 På Svea Solar främjar vi mångfald och inkludering eftersom olika perspektiv driver innovation. Här får du växa professionellt medan vi växer som bolag och bidra till framtidens energilösningar. Som en del av vårt team blir du en viktig del av "The Power Shift" – mot en grönare framtid, med fokus på teamwork, tillväxt och en härlig arbetsmiljö. 🌱🌞
   

  

**Om rekryteringsprocessen**
* Vi kommer att börja gå igenom ansökningar direkt, så vänta inte med att ansöka!
* På den här sidan hittar du mer information om vår rekryteringsprocess.
* För den slutgiltiga kandidaten gör vi en bakgrundskontroll av brottsregister.
