title: Embedded Software Engineer within automotive
description:
Are you someone with embedded software development experience and looking for a new challenge? Do you like working in an entrepreneurial technology excellence company? We welcome applications from both senior and talented junior engineers!
  
About the role
  
Your main tasks include development of embedded software. As a Software Engineer at Carabiner you will work with some of the world’s largest brands in the automotive industry. We have strong ties into the area of autonomous vehicles as well as electromobility. What we are looking for are developers who feel ownership of what they develop and see the development language as just one of the tools used in their craft. We’ll be happy if you also want to contribute to how we can strengthen and develop the Carabiner offering in the area.
  
About you
  
You have a University Degree in Electrical Engineering, Physics, Computer Science, Mechatronics, or other relevant technical field of study. You have at least 6 years of documented experience from embedded software development, preferably no less than 2 years in the automotive industry.
  
**Programming language:** C++/C, Python
  
**Protocols:** CAN, LIN, FlexRay
  
**Tools:** GiT, JIRA, SVN, MatLab, Simulink
  
**Software processes / standards:** ASPICE, ISO 26262
  
It is also meritorious if you have;
  
* Experience from development of autonomous drive, driver assistance systems or electromobility.
* Hands on experience as software architect, continuous integration and configuration management.
* Experience from model-based development.


As a person
  
You share our passion for security and functional safety! You have a high integrity and excellent communication skills. You are a reliable team player, comfortable taking the lead when needed. You enjoy collaboration with different stakeholders as well as the freedom and responsibility to act independently. You have a strong customer focus and work in a structured way to deliver upon expectations!
  
About us
  
Carabiner is an engineering company with its headquarters in Gothenburg, Sweden. We offer engineering services for development of embedded systems with technological excellence in functional safety. Our company is built upon the idea to contribute to a safer world. We strongly believe in empowering and respecting diversity, perspectives and experiences to reach our goals and create a great place to work. Here at Carabiner, you will have a chance to join a highly specialized and diverse team at Carabiner, a chance to develop your skills in a highly dynamic working environment and having fun while doing so. Our homely atmosphere mediates the importance of teamwork and individual contributions. We nurture continuous competence development.
  
How to Apply and Connect
  
Is this you? Do not wait with your application! We welcome applications from both senior and talented junior engineers and will start the recruitment process immediately.
  
Apply by sending your CV to career@carabiner.se. We welcome your application by April the 10th, 2025 at the latest. Mark your application with ‘Embedded Software Engineer April 2025’.
  
For questions regarding the position please contact our Recruitment Manager Victor Holkert at victor.holkert@carabiner.se

title: Data Management
description:
Är du en analytisk och strukturerad person med ett skarpt öga för datahantering? Vill du vara med och utveckla digitala lösningar hos några av Göteborgs mest spännande företag samtidigt som du växer med oss och bli en del av vårt team i Göteborg.


Vi på Biner har lång erfarenhet inom IT och digital transformation. Nu söker vi specialister som vill vara med och driva utvecklingen framåt. Hos oss får du arbeta med branschens främsta experter inom datahantering, arkitektur och verksamhetsutveckling och skapa verklig förändring. Hur vi arbetar berättar vi gärna mer när vi ses!

 **Arbetsbeskrivning**

  

Rollen som Data Management Specialist passar dig som har en analytisk förmåga och erfarenhet av att hantera och strukturera stora datamängder. Du är van att arbeta med datamodeller, metadatahantering och säkerställa datakvalitet inom verksamheter.


Du arbetar nära både affärs- och IT-avdelningar för att implementera strategier, optimera databashantering och säkerställa att data används strategiskt i organisationen.

**Du har:**

* God förmåga av effektiv datahantering, säkerställa datakvalitet och efterlevnad av regelverk och standarder.
* Stark analytisk och strategisk förmåga.
* God kommunikativ förmåga och affärsförståelse.
* En konsultmässig inställning med förmåga att anpassa dig till olika uppdrag och kundmiljöer.

**Kvalifikationer:**

* Erfarenhet av databashanteringssystem och datalagringslösningar.
* Akademisk examen inom datavetenskap, informationsteknologi eller liknande.
* Mångårig erfarenhet inom Data Management, Data Governance eller liknande.
* Flytande kunskaper i svenska och engelska.


Meriterande är erfarenhet av att arbeta med dataintegration, master data
  

management (MDM) och BI-verktyg.

 **Biners som arbetsgivare**


På Biner är våra medarbetare vår framgång! Vi är ett växande företag där våra konsulttjänster är eftertraktade. Här får du möjligheten att utvecklas i en organisation som satsar på sin personal och erbjuder en kultur där kunskapsdelning och samarbete står i centrum.

 **Biners erbjudande**


Möjlighet att arbeta i spännande kundprojekt med starka team.
  

Professionell utveckling genom utbildningar och kompetensutbyte.  

Ett unikt nätverk av erfarna kollegor.  

En företagskultur som värdesätter innovation, engagemang och samarbete. På Biner kommer du att få förmånen att arbeta med IT & verksamhetsfrågor på strategisk, taktisk och operativ nivå och med de utmaningar som våra kunder står inför som komplexa system, hantering av data, outsourcing, effektivisering och värdeskapande IT-leveranser.  

  

**Ansökan**


Urval sker löpande, så skicka in din ansökan redan idag! **Varmt välkommen att bli en del av Biner!**

title: Var med på resan i Spendrups nya IT-ServiceDesk!
description:
**Anställningsform:** heltid, tillsvidare/konsultuppdrag **| Tillträdesdag:** så snart som möjligt


Här söker vi dig som är i början av din karriär och har börjat bygga upp din kunskap inom IT-support i en Microsoftmiljö. Spendrups är på en spännande resa där man gör om sin ServiceDesk och här får du vara med från början och bygga upp den tillsammans med riktigt härliga kollegor!


Om tjänsten


Spendrups är ett äkta familjeföretag som drivs i fjärde generationen med flera familjemedlemmar som aktiva eldsjälar i hjärtat av verksamheten. I organisationen ingår 1100 medarbetare, som jobbar i Grängesberg, Hällefors, Visby, Stockholm och på alla terminaler och säljkontor runt om i Sverige. Deras kärnverksamhet ligger i sina bryggerier där de gör öl i världsklass men också läsk, mineralvatten m.m.


Som ServiceDesk-medarbetare är du dina kollegors första kontaktpunkt för IT-support. Du kommer ta emot, kategorisera och lösa IT-relaterade ärenden samt ge support till användare via framförallt ärendehanteringssystem men också telefon och e-post. IT-miljön är framförallt Microsoftbaserad med många Office 365 relaterade ärenden men man supporterar även iPhones, iPads, konferensutrustning, skrivare och Androidtelefoner. I den här rollen kommer du vara på kontoret fem dagar i veckan för att kunna ge personlig service och vara närvarande för dina kollegor.

**Du erbjuds**

* Att vara med i uppbyggandet av den nya IT-support funktionen på Spendrups, ett företag som kommer göra stora satsningar inom IT kommande år
* Att jobba i en fantastisk företagskultur med härliga kollegor och god stämning
* På Spendrups präglas kulturen av öppenhet, och dina idéer värdesätts. Här får du chansen att inte bara lösa problem utan också aktivt bidra till att förbättra och utveckla IT-supporten
* En trygg anställning hos Academic Work under hela din tid på Spendrups
* 

**Arbetsuppgifter**

* Hantera inkommande ärenden via telefon, e-post och ärendehanteringssystem och säkerställa att de loggas korrekt
* Felsöka och lösa IT-relaterade problem såsom inloggningsproblem, nätverksproblem, programvarufrågor och hårdvarurelaterade problem.
* Delta i interna möten och utbildningar för att kontinuerligt förbättra kompetens och serviceleverans
* Uppdatera och underhålla ärenden i ärendehanteringssystemet för spårbarhet och uppföljning samt säkerställa snabb och korrekt dokumentation
* Ge användarstöd och vägledning i IT-relaterade frågor, inklusive Microsoft 365, VPN, fjärråtkomst och olika affärsapplikationer
* Hantera användarkonton, behörigheter och åtkomsthantering i Active Directory och andra system


Som IT-support ansvarar du även för att dokumentera lösningar, skapa guider och bidra till kunskapsdatabasen för att förbättra självservicealternativ. Du testar och utvärderar nya IT-lösningar och rapporterar eventuella förbättringsförslag till IT-avdelningen. Vid mer komplexa ärenden eskalerar du dessa till rätt supportnivå enligt gällande rutiner och följer upp de eskalerade ärendena. Dessutom ger du fjärrsupport och vägleder användare genom tekniska problem.


Trots att Spendrups är ett stort bolag präglas kulturen av öppenhet. Här uppmuntras dina idéer, och du får chansen att påverka och förbättra IT-supporten med dina insikter.

  


**Vi söker dig som**

* Har tidigare erfarenhet av att arbeta i en IT-support
* Kunskaper inom Windows OS, Microsoft 365, nätverk och Active Directory
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta i ärendehanteringssystem
* Flytande i svenska i tal och skrift samt goda kunskaper i engelska

**Det är meriterande om du har**

* Erfarenhet av Cisco Meraki nätverkslösningar, HP Skrivare, Azure, Entra ID

**För att lyckas i rollen har du följande personliga egenskaper:**

* **Hjälpsam** – Du trivs med att stödja dina kollegor och ser till att de får den IT-support de behöver på ett snabbt och professionellt sätt.
* **Social** – Du har lätt för att kommunicera och skapa goda relationer, både med tekniskt kunniga och de som behöver extra vägledning.
* **Ordningsam** – Du håller struktur på dina ärenden, säkerställer att inget faller mellan stolarna och dokumenterar lösningar för framtida effektivitet.
* **Ansvarstagande** – Du tar initiativ, ser till att problem blir lösta och vågar ta ansvar för att förbättra IT-supporten inom organisationen.


För denna rekrytering kommer vi lägga stor vikt vid personlighet om lämplighet för rollen. Som person är du mån om att ge folk runtomkring dig ett bra personligt bemötande och trivs i en social arbetsmiljö. En **bakgrundskontroll** samt **kreditupplysning** kommer göras på den kandidat som anställs för uppdraget och denna måste godkännas av Spendrups säkerhetsavdelning innan man kan tillträda tjänsten.

  


**Vår rekryteringsprocess**

  

I denna rekryteringsprocess samarbetar vi med Academic Work och alla frågor rörande tjänsten skickas till Academic Work.


Vi tillämpar löpande urval och kommer plocka ner annonsen när tillräckligt många kandidater har nått slutskedet i rekryteringsprocessen. Rekryteringsprocessen innehåller två urvalstest: ett personlighetstest och ett test i kognitiv förmåga. Testerna är ett verktyg för att kunna hitta den kandidat med högst potential för tjänsten samt främja jämlikhet, mångfald och en rättvis rekryteringsprocess.

**Har du frågor?**


Nils Norgren eller någon av kollegorna i rekryteringsteamet svarar dig gärna på sth2@academicwork.se Ange annons-ID i ditt mail: LOI6UC

  

Spendrups vision är att vara ett bryggeri i världsklass. Det innebär att vi stolt vill kunna jämföra oss med de bästa i världen i allt vi gör. Det gäller de produkter vi lanserar och de relationer vi bygger, hur vi agerar i nuet och hur vi satsar på sikt. Vår mission är att med kreativ kraft, långsiktigt ansvarstagande och passion skapa smakupplevelser och relationer i världsklass. Som medarbetare på Spendrups har du en viktig roll i vår gemensamma strävan mot världsklass och vi ser gärna att du identifierar dig själv med våra värderingar: Stolthet, Äkthet, Nyskapande och Handlingskraft.

 **Välkommen in!**

title: Tech Lead Manager
description:
**About Sinch**
 Sinch is pioneering the way the world communicates. More than 150,000 businesses — including Google, Uber, Paypal, Visa, Tinder, and many others — rely on Sinch's Customer Communications Cloud to power engaging customer experiences through mobile messaging, voice, and email.
   

  

 Whether you need to verify users or craft omnichannel campaigns, Sinch makes it easy. Our AI-infused Super Network, APIs, and applications ensure you can connect with your customers reliably and securely, at every step of their journey.
   

  

 At Sinch we "Dream Big", "Win Together", "Keep it simple", and "Make it Happen". These values are our foundation!
   

  

**Description**
 You will act as both Tech Lead and Manager, in a perfect mix of leading people (Team of Developers) and developing code. Our aim is to consolidate the team of developers that you will lead in Stockholm. You will collaborate with your Product Partner, regarding planning and building the right products at the right time. You will be responsible for defining clear goals for your team and lead them in delivering on those goals.
   

  

 Apart from this, you are also responsible for setting salaries, helping individuals on your team grow and developing, as well as contributing technically to the team.
   

  

 As Tech Lead Manager you have a holistic perspective and the ability to inspire and lead others. You love working with tech and have experience working as a developer, working with code reviews, testing and quality assurance. You have at least one area where your team can rely on you making strong technical contributions.
   

  

* Communicate and collaborate with stakeholders
* Define quarterly goals and do weekly follow-ups
* Support and make sure the team members are the best they can be
* Develop and coach your team members individually
* Facilitate daily stand-ups and advise on agile WoW
* Contribute technically (wherever your strong area is) to the team


**Requirements**
* MSc/BS in computer science or similar degree
* Experience working as a Manager for a Tech Team
* Working in different contexts and organisations
* Interest in leadership and developing teams
* Proficient in English, both verbal and written
* Business minded and able to see the big picture
* A natural leader who is caring and inspiring
* Able to communicate clearly, both with your team and stakeholders
* Well organized and goal oriented


**Our Hiring Process**
 We are committed to ensuring a recruitment process that is fair, objective, consistent, and inclusive. Our approach includes structured, competency-based interviews designed to evaluate your skills, experience, and qualifications relevant to the role. At times, we may include a data-driven assessment to enhance our hiring success and identify candidates likely to excel.
   

  

 We believe in a two-way process and encourage you to ask questions throughout the journey. If this role isn't what you're looking for, please explore the other opportunities listed on our career page: https://www.sinch.com/careers/. No matter who you are, we hope you find an exciting path forward - hopefully with us!

title: National Technology Internship Opportunities
description:
**Overview**
 Come build community, explore your passions and do your best work at Microsoft with thousands of University interns from every corner of the world. This opportunity will allow you to bring your aspirations, talent, potential—and excitement for the journey ahead.
   

  

 As a National Technology Intern, you will drive long-term market shaping and development for Public Sector, all regulated industries, and/or other industries and create a positive environment to expand market. You will build bridges between regulatory and customer engagements as an ambassador of Microsoft and support CELA-led projects and contributes to policy-shaping efforts. You will remove sales blockers with internal and external stakeholders while supporting the field to build internal/external capacity. You will provide feedback on product capabilities and roadmap and engage within the NTO Community to share best practices.
   

  

 At Microsoft, Interns work on real-world projects in collaboration with teams across the world, while having fun along the way. You’ll be empowered to build community, explore your passions and achieve your goals. This is your chance to bring your solutions and ideas to life while working on cutting-edge technology.
   

  

 Microsoft’s mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. As employees we come together with a growth mindset, innovate to empower others, and collaborate to realize our shared goals. Each day we build on our values of respect, integrity, and accountability to create a culture of inclusion where everyone can thrive at work and beyond.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
**Start date: September 2025**
**Type of Employment: Internship**
* Technical and Customer Insights: Support the local NTSO office by helping with technical and customer insights on critical infrastructure, digital sovereignty, economic trends, national data strategies and emerging technologies.
* Policy and Industry Engagement: Contribute to the work of identifying and engaging with relevant policy, advisory, industry, and standardization bodies on cutting edge technologies and business transformation.
* Regulatory Support: Support, guide and partner Microsoft’s local legal and government affairs team (CELA) in engagements with regulators on technical issues relating to key priorities (e.g., data privacy, cybersecurity, sovereignty, and compliance).
* Cybersecurity Projects: Participate in cybersecurity policy projects and strategy development.
* Network Building: Support in identifying, engaging and building networks with relevant advisory, industry and standardization bodies on cloud, data and artificial intelligence (AI) to enhance Microsoft’s thought leadership.
* Public Sector Opportunities: Contribute to medium- to long-term opportunities for the Swedish Public Sector, regulated industries and other relevant industries.
* Outreach and Presentations: Support the Swedish subsidiary in outreach projects, presentations at customer meetings, podcasts, events and customer roundtables on topics such as trust, AI and security.


**Qualifications**
**Required Qualifications**
* Currently pursuing a Bachelor's, Master’s or PhD Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, or related field
* You must be legally authorised to work in Sweden to be eligible for this role. (Legally authorised = has citizenship or has been granted a valid visa or work permit)
* Fluent in Swedish


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Strong interest in technology, policy, and business transformation
* Excellent communication and networking skills
* Ability to work collaboratively with diverse teams
* Proactive and eager to learn.


 Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form .
   

  

 Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.

title: Unit Manager - Cyber Defence Center
description:
**Job Description**
 H&M Group is transforming the way it addresses the continuously evolving and complex cyber security threats and risks. To do this we have a Tech Centre focused solely on managing Cyber Security for all our brands and majority investments.
   

  

 Within this Cyber Security Tech Centre, we have a Cyber Defence Center (CDC) that is a key security function at H&M Group, which aims to detect and respond to threats to our data or technology systems, 24 x 7. The CDC has 3 teams located both in Stockholm and India, and consists of Cyber Defence Analysts, Attack Surface Reduction Analyst and Cyber Defence Engineers. The CDC also leverages the best-in-class security technology and security providers.
   

  

 This role reports to the Chief Technology Risk Information Officer (CISO).
   

  

**Responsibilities:**
* Lead and manage the Cyber Defence Center, ensuring effective coordination and collaboration among cyber defence teams.
* Develop and implement comprehensive cyber security strategies to protect the organization's digital assets.
* Provide leadership and technical guidance to managers of cyber defence teams, fostering a culture of continuous improvement and innovation.
* Enable strong organizational health by making sure that your employees prioritize both deliveries as well as own competence development.
* Oversee the identification, assessment, and mitigation of cyber threats and vulnerabilities.
* Ensure compliance with relevant cyber security regulations and standards.
* Own and manage the cyber incident response and recovery processes, including coordination with stakeholders.
* Monitor and analyze cyber security trends and emerging threats to proactively address potential risks.
* Collaborate with other departments to integrate cyber security measures into business processes and initiatives.
* Prepare and present regular reports on the status of cyber security initiatives to senior management.
* Manage the units’ budget and monitor its financial effectiveness.
* Formal staff responsibility, including salary review, performance dialogues and support in individual development plans and competence needs.
* Contribute operationally, where necessary.


**Qualifications**
* Minimum of 10 years of experience in cyber security, with at least 5 years in a leadership role.
* Proven track record of managing and leading cyber defense teams.
* In-depth knowledge of cyber security frameworks, standards, and best practices.
* Strong understanding and a hands-on approach to threat intelligence, risk management, and incident response.
* Strong communication experience with demonstrated ability to influence people, even at senior levels, and ability to communicate in a timely and clear way
* Ability to coach others in a way that enables them to grow professionally and to increase their performance
* Experience setting and handling resource allocation budget.
* Experience with handling difficult situations both in uncertain circumstances as well as in employee related matters.
* Good at balancing striving for speed, reducing complexity, and focusing on the outcome
* Experience in managing complex cyber security projects and initiatives in a global scale
* Exceptional leadership skills, with the ability to develop and grow your colleagues in complex environments.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Ability to work under pressure and handle multiple priorities.
* Relevant certifications such as CISSP, CISM, or equivalent.


**Additional Information**
 This is a fulltime permanent position. The role is
 **based in our office in Stockholm, Sweden** 
 .
   

  

 Apply by sending in your
 **CV in English** 
 as soon as possible. Due to data policies, we only accept applications through career page.
   

  

**Benefits**
 We offer all our employees at H&M Group attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe. All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET, Afound. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here.
   

  

 In addition to our global benefits, all our local markets offer different competitive perks and benefits. Please note that they may differ between employment type and countries.
   

  

**Inclusion & Diversity**
 At H&M Group, we’re determined to create and maintain inclusive, diverse and equitable workplaces throughout our organisation. Our teams should consist of a variety of people that share and combine their knowledge, experience and ideas. Having a diverse workforce leads to a positive impact on how we address challenges, on what we perceive possible and on how we choose to relate to our colleagues and customers all over the world. Hence all diversity dimensions are taken into consideration in our recruitment process.
   

  

 We strive to have a fair and equal process and therefore kindly ask you not to attach a cover letter in your application as they often contain information that easily can trigger unintentional biases.
   

  

**Company Description**
 H&M Group is a family of brands; H&M, COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET and Afound. At H&M Group, our people are the driving force behind our commitment to creating meaningful growth and more sustainable lifestyles. Help us re-imagine fashion and together we will re-shape our industry. Learn more about H&M Group here.

title: IT Operations Lead
description:
About us:
   

  

 Legora is working to empower lawyers and automate legal work. Our approach is to enable the lawyer of the future: a human-AI lawyer who's an order of magnitude more effective than a team of conventional legal professionals. The human-AI lawyer will iterate at the speed of their judgment, even in the most complex legal scenarios, and will out-smart and out-deliver the best pure AI system.
   

  

 You are joining an early-stage scale-up with exceptional product-market fit that thousands of lawyers use daily at global institutions such as Bird&Bird, Mannheimer Swartling, and Heineken. Backed by $35+M in funding from top investors like Benchmark, Redpoint, and Y Combinator, Legora is a group of exceptional engineers, lawyers, and doers. Here, you will have infinite room to grow and rethink how truly worthwhile work gets done.
   

  

 The role:
   

  

 We are looking for an experienced and proactive IT Operations Lead to take ownership of our internal IT operations and infrastructure. You will own IT infrastructure and operations in a fast-growing, international scale-up, working cross-functionally with leadership to ensure compliance, security, and operational excellence. Your responsibilities include managing IT operations, automating workflows, handling user lifecycle processes (onboarding/offboarding), overseeing hardware procurement and asset management, and optimizing SaaS procurement and budgeting. You’ll drive identity and access management (IAM), mobile device management (MDM), and administer key tools like Google Workspace and Slack. If you’re highly organized, solutions-focused, and thrive in fast-paced environments, we want to hear from you!
   

  

 Key Responsibilities:
   

  

* Manage and optimize productivity platforms (Google Workspace, GitHub, Slack, Miro, Linear, etc.)
* Ensure employees have the necessary tools and systems while keeping costs efficient
* Automate workflows and integrate tools to eliminate unnecessary manual tasks
* Implement zero-touch onboarding/offboarding processes across all tools
* Oversee patch management, support, and configuration of laptops and mobile devices
* Manage identity and access management (IAM) and security protocols
* Maintain office technology, including internet, alarms, and meeting room setups
* Ensure policies and controls aligned with SOC2 and ISO standards are implemented and adhered to


 Who you are:
   

  

* Integrity: As the backbone of Legora's IT operations, you will have access to critical systems and information. Trust, transparency, and accountability are essential.
* Diligent: You take full ownership of IT systems and processes, ensuring everything runs seamlessly.
* Autonomous: While working in a team, you lead with self-initiative, valuing feedback and focusing on solutions. You are proactive, innovative, and unafraid to take on new challenges.
* Entrepreneurial: Legora is a fast-growing scale-up. Things move quickly, and responsibilities evolve. You thrive in dynamic environments and are excited about shaping how IT supports a world-class AI-powered legal platform.


 Qualifications & Skills:
   

  

* 5+ years of experience in IT support, IT operations, or related roles
* Hands-on experience with IAM, MDM, and SaaS management, in cloud based companies
* Strong understanding of automation and workflow optimization
* Excellent problem-solving and troubleshooting skills
* Ability to work independently and manage multiple projects simultaneously


 Preferred Qualifications:
   

  

* Experience working with SOC2 and ISO compliance
* Prior experience in a fast-growing startup or scale-up environment


 Practical Information:
   

  

* Career development opportunities in a rapidly evolving entrepreneurial environment.
* A collaborative, high-energy team environment where your ideas and contributions are valued and implemented.
* Competitive salary complemented with a transparent and highly competitive options program.
* Centrally located offices in Stockholm, designed as a space for you to do your life's work.


 We founded Legora with the vision of giving lawyers the tools they deserve.
   

  

 We didn't build Legora for how law is practiced today; we built it for how it should be practiced tomorrow.

title: Azure Application Modernization Architect
company_industry: Computer and Network Security and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
**About The Role**
**Location** 
 Amsterdam, Netherlands
   

  

 At Atos, we’re seeking an Azure Application Modernization Architect to help our clients navigate their digital transformation journeys. You’ll collaborate with clients to assess legacy applications and craft innovative modernization strategies using the latest Azure technologies. This is your chance to make a significant impact by driving the re-platforming and modernization of complex enterprise applications to the cloud, ensuring scalability and efficiency.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Collaborate with clients to evaluate their legacy applications and define a strategic path for modernization.
* Architect and design solutions using Azure App Services, AKS, Logic Apps, and API Management to create high-performance cloud-native applications.
* Support sales and presales teams by providing technical expertise during client discussions and responses to RFPs.
* Develop proof-of-concept (PoC) solutions to demonstrate the potential and capabilities of modernized applications.
* Ensure seamless integration of modernized applications with existing systems, delivering solutions that meet business needs.
* Provide guidance on re-platforming, refactoring, and rebuilding legacy applications to make them future-ready on Azure.
* Stay updated on the latest modernization frameworks and cloud-native development practices, ensuring your solutions are at the forefront of technology.


**What We’re Looking For**
* 8+ years of experience in IT, with at least 4+ years in application modernization and Azure technologies.
* Proven experience with Azure cloud-native services and deep knowledge of DevOps practices.
* Hands-on expertise in containerization using Docker and orchestration with Kubernetes.
* Relevant certifications such as DevOps Engineer Expert or Azure Solutions Architect Expert are a plus.
* Dutch language skills are preferred but not mandatory.
* Strong leadership and communication skills with the ability to guide teams and influence key stakeholders.


**What Atos Offers You**
 At Atos, we believe in empowering our employees to thrive. We offer an inspiring environment where you’ll have opportunities to grow both professionally and personally. We provide the tools, training, and opportunities you need to continue developing your skills and expertise in an ever-evolving industry. The benefits we offer include
   

  

* A competitive salary and attractive benefits (including a year-end bonus and pension plan).
* A flexible working environment with opportunities to balance your work and personal life—whether through flexible hours or part-time arrangements.
* 29 vacation days per year to help you recharge.
* A mobility budget to suit your needs.
* The chance to work on exciting projects with prestigious clients, developing innovative solutions and furthering your expertise.
* International career growth opportunities within the Atos network, allowing you to expand your professional horizons.
* Access to extensive training and development programs, helping you stay at the forefront of the latest cloud technologies.
* A collaborative and inclusive culture where diversity is celebrated, and innovation thrives through teamwork.


**Why Join Us?**
 At Atos, you’ll be part of a global leader in digital transformation, shaping the future of cloud technology. We foster a diverse, inclusive, and innovative environment where your ideas and contributions are valued. Join us and make a lasting impact, creating solutions that shape the future of business.
   

  

 If you're ready to take on exciting challenges, expand your career, and work with cutting-edge technologies, we’d love to hear from you. Apply today and be part of Atos!

title: Chief Information Officer (CIO)
company_industry: Software Development, Information Services, and Technology, Information and Media
description:
Do you want to help us unleash the secret to how happy employees create a happy business? We are an innovative, agile, and continuously growing modern tech company on a path to improving the work lives of millions around the world.
 



  





**We develop workforce management solutions** 
 - software that makes scheduling and time reporting more smooth and more flexible for almost a million users worldwide!
 



  





**We value passion, quality, innovation, trust, and collaboration.** 
 You’ll be given the opportunity to make an impact and directly contribute to our success, bring new ideas, and have full ownership of your area.
 



 Are you curious and ready to take the first steps on an awesome journey and make magic happen with us? As a member of Quinyx, you will be part of an inclusive and diverse workplace where everyone is allowed to be themselves and thrive.
 



  





*We have a hybrid working set up and therefore you will be required to attend our Stockholm office minimum twice per week.* 




  





**About the role** 




  





 A Chief Information Officer (CIO) is the senior-level executive within an organization responsible for establishing and maintaining the enterprise
 **vision** 
 ,
 **strategy** 
 , and
 **program** 
 to ensure information assets and technologies are adequately protected.
 



  





 The role is broken into three key areas of responsibility:
 



  





 1. Information security
 



 2. IT, infrastructure and networks
 



 3. Internal data and reporting
 



  





 As CIO you will be responsible for developing integrated strategies and programs of work covering all three areas listed above delivering maximum value to the business, as well as acting as a chief information security officer (CISO).
 



  





 The CIO role directs staff in developing, implementing, and maintaining processes across the business for IT procurement, deployment and usage within Quinyx. This role also includes the development and deployment of internal data strategies and assets that can be used by the business for reporting and operations purposes.
 



  





 The CISO directs staff in identifying, developing, implementing, and maintaining processes across the enterprise to reduce information and information technology (IT) risks. They respond to incidents, establish appropriate standards and controls, manage security technologies, and direct the establishment and implementation of policies and procedures. The CISO is also usually responsible for information-related compliance (e.g. ISO/IEC 27001 and SOC 2 certification).
 



  





**What you’ll be doing** 




  




* Develop, implement and monitor a strategic, comprehensive enterprise information security and IT risk management program.
* Work directly with the business units to facilitate risk assessment and risk management processes.
* Develop and enhance an information security management framework.
* Understand and interact with related disciplines through committees to ensure the consistent application of policies and standards across all technology projects, systems and services.
* Provide leadership to the enterprise's information security organization.
* Partner with business stakeholders across the company to raise awareness of risk management concerns.
* Assist with the overall business technology planning, providing a current knowledge and future vision of technology, data and systems.
* Developing internal data and reporting strategies and systems.
* Managing IT staff and developing department goals.
* Developing and overseeing the IT budget.
* Planning, deploying and maintaining IT systems and operations.
* Developing IT policies, procedures and best practices.
* Staying updated on IT trends and emerging technologies.
* Developing and enforcing IT best practices across the organization.
* Ensuring IT strategies and processes support company-wide goals.
* Overseeing relationships with vendors, contractors and service providers.
* Explaining to the board of directors and other executives the benefits and risks of new IT-related projects.



  





**What you’ll bring to the team** 




  




* Degree in business administration or a technology-related field required.
* Professional security management certification.
* Extensive experience in a combination of risk management, information security and IT jobs.
* Knowledge of common information security management frameworks, such as ISO/IEC 27001, NIST, SOC 2.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills and high level of personal integrity.
* Innovative thinking and leadership with an ability to lead and motivate cross-functional, interdisciplinary teams.
* Experience with contract and vendor negotiations and management including managed services.
* Specific experience in agile software development or other best in class development practices.
* Ability to articulate IT security and technical issues in a non-threatening, clear and actionable manner to non-technical leadership.
* Knowledge of regulation and standards compliance.
* Proficiency in establishing IT services framework and IT security policies.
* Internal data strategies and reporting frameworks.
* Data quality initiatives and processes.
* Master data management principles and information system design.



  





**What is it for you?** 




  





 We promote and encourage a healthy lifestyle with flexible work hours and latest tools, enhanced vacation allowance, gym membership contribution, and last but not least, you will have the chance to participate in our well-known yearly ugly Xmas sweater competition!
 



  





**Life at Quinyx** 




  





 We are an innovative, agile and continuously growing modern tech company. We value passion, creativity, quality and simplicity. You’ll be given the opportunity to make an impact and directly contribute to our success, bring new ideas and have full ownership of your area.
 



 Our global team, of 30 nationalities, have fun together whether it is during a typical Swedish Fika, workshop, going for a run with a colleague or spending time together during our regular after-work socials. We have built a family atmosphere here at Quinyx and are committed to share knowledge and support one another!
 



  





**Want to join the family?** 




  





 At Quinyx, we provide equal employment opportunities and we strive to have an inclusive and diverse value-driven culture. All applications will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, disability or Veteran status.
 



  





**Happy Workforce, Happy Business!** 




  





*All candidates are subject to background checks.*

title: Tech Director - Stockholm
description:
Welcome to
 **Umain** 
 - a digital product consultancy based in the heart of Stockholm, Sweden, and a part of
 **Eidra** 
 . We're not just creating software; we're crafting the future, one innovative project at a time. With our motto
 **"Shape, Ship, Scale,"** 
 we empower our team to envision the future and play a pivotal role in building it for our clients. We're a dynamic group where you can shape groundbreaking technical solutions, ship them to market, and scale your influence across various industries.
   

  

 We're on the lookout for a
 **Tech Director** 
 ready to lead this journey, bringing technical expertise, strategic vision, and a collaborative spirit along with them. Whether you're a seasoned leader or eager to take on bigger challenges, this role offers the opportunity to work on exciting projects and lead teams through the complex landscape of modern digital solutions.
   

  

**What We Offer**
* A chance to lead unique projects that push the boundaries of what's possible in technology.
* A fun and fair work environment with opportunities to expand your technical leadership and strategic skills alongside highly ambitious colleagues.
* A personal coach and a setting where you can grow both professionally and personally.
* The opportunity to work in multidisciplinary agile teams, collaborating with experts across design, development, and strategy.


**As a Tech Director at Umain, your role will involve:**
* Technical Leadership: Define and communicate technical vision for multiple projects, ensuring they are innovative, scalable, and aligned with Umain's strategic goals.
* Solution Architecture: Oversee the design and development of technical solutions that meet client needs and industry standards in scalability, security, and sustainability.
* Client Engagement: Act as the technical interface with clients, translating their business needs into technical strategies and delivering clear, impactful solutions.
* Project Oversight: Monitor and support project teams, resolving technical challenges, and ensuring timely, high-quality deliveries.
* Mentorship: Guide and mentor development teams, promoting best practices and continuous learning.


**Who You Are**
* You're a Tech Director with a passion for leadership, technology, and problem-solving.
* You thrive in dynamic environments, eager to take on new challenges and grow your technical influence.
* You believe in the power of collaboration and diversity, recognizing the impact you can make by working closely with cross-functional teams.
* You're an innovator who values technology's role in shaping the future.


**Why Umain?**
* Career Framework: We believe in fairness and transparency, which is why we've established a clear career framework to ensure equal pay and equal opportunities. Your growth is important to us, and you'll work closely with your coach to build a development plan that supports your career goals.
* Work-Life Balance: At Umain, we embrace diversity and understand that life doesn't stop when you come to work. We've created a supportive environment that promotes a healthy work-life balance, welcoming individuals from all backgrounds and life stages. Whether you’re caring for your family, your pets, or yourself, we’re committed to helping you find balance.
* Innovation and Learning: Technology is ever-evolving, and at Umain, we’re committed to continuous learning. You'll work with a talented group of developers, designers, and analysts to tackle new challenges, share knowledge, and grow together.
* Skills Over Degrees: We value talent, drive, and creativity over formal education. If you have the ambition to succeed and the passion for technology, Umain is the place where you can thrive, no matter your educational background.


**Are You Ready to Shape, Ship, and Scale with Us?**
 If you're a
 **Tech Director** 
 who thrives on innovation, values a supportive and inclusive workplace, and is eager to make a tangible impact on the future, we’d love to hear from you. Let’s build something awesome together.
   

  

 Umain is a digital product consultancy. We shape, ship and scale digital products at speed. Founded in Stockholm in 2001, we are a growing team of 100+ experts in digital product strategy, design, and technology.
   

  

 We are a part of Eidra, a group of top-notch companies specializing in strategy, creativity, and engineering. As a collective we guide leaders in making meaningful and lasting change.

title: It-arkitekt säkerhetstjänster
description:
Vill du vara med att säkerställa it-säkerhetsförmågan för Skatteverket och Myndighetssverige? Nu har du chansen att kliva ombord på vår resa mot en innovativ och digitaliserad framtid, där vi inte bara stärker it-tjänster och drift för våra egna system utan även för andra statliga myndigheter. Vi bygger en ny dynamisk enhet full av kompetens och driv. Vi söker nu erfarna it-arkitekter inom it-säkerhetsområdet med tidigare erfarenhet från komplexa it miljöer och organisationer. Vill du vara med och skapa säkra och skalbara lösningar för Skatteverket och andra myndigheter ? Var med och gör samhället möjligt!
   

  

**Om jobbet**
 Skatteverket går nu in i en ny fas. Som it-tjänsteleverantör till andra statliga myndigheter skalar vi upp och stärker vår förmåga med nya medarbetare som vill jobba med utveckling och leverans av dessa tjänster. I rollen som it-arkitekt inom tjänsteutveckling och del av arkitekturstyrningen är du en nyckelperson i vårt förflyttningsarbete. Du kommer att arbeta med arkitektur inom tjänsteområde säkerhetstjänster. Vi söker nu it-arkitekter med erfarenhet inom områdena; säker kommunikation, applikationssäkerhet och/eller IAM.
   

  

 Du kommer arbeta tillsammans i tjänsteteamet med att proaktivt utveckla områdets tjänster parallellt med att möta Skatteverkets och andra anslutna myndigheters ställda verksamhetsbehov. Du tar fram och anpassar arkitekturkoncept baserat på gällande lagstiftning och styrande ramverk, samt rekommenderar vad som skapar nytta utifrån ställda krav för att möta verksamhetens behov. Du skapar beslutsunderlag och driver förändring. Tillsammans med tjänsteägaren och tjänsteansvariga arbetar du fram framtidens tjänster och vidareutvecklar befintliga.
   

  

 Du är en av arkitekterna inom tjänsteområde där ni tillsammans stöttar varandra och ni rör er mellan rollerna som enterprisearkitekt och systemarkitekt. I rollen har du primära fokusområden som du ansvarar för men du tar ett helhetsperspektiv för hela tjänsteområdet parallellt och stöttar med din kompetens. Du rör dig obehindrat mellan strategisk, taktisk och operativ nivå. Du känner dig lika bekväm med att förklara och utveckla arkitektur i nära samarbete med leveransteamen på operativ nivå som att förklara helheten och riktningen för ledning och beställare på taktisk och strategisk nivå.
   

  

 Skatteverkets it-verksamhet och tekniska miljö är bred men vi förflyttar oss stegvis över mot modernare lösningar såsom private cloud, micro services och containerteknik, parallellt med att följa gällande lagstiftning, ramverk och styrande dokument för att bibehålla säkra robusta lösningar som uppfyller ställda säkerhetskrav. Vi förväntar oss att du har kunskap om den senaste tekniken och utvecklingen gällande lagstiftning inom ditt område.
   

  

 Skatteverkets it-avdelning är en av Sveriges största it-avdelningar med närmare 1500 medarbetare som ansvarar för utveckling, drift och förvaltning av Skatteverkets it-landskap. Storleken bidrar också till att vi exempelvis har ett levande arkitekturnätverk som regelbundet träffas och lär av varandra.
   

  

 Du tillhör Säkerhetstjänstesektionen på it-avdelningen, med placering i Sundbyberg.
   

  

**Om dig**
 För att göra ett bra jobb och trivas hos oss på Skatteverket behöver du vara lyhörd, tänka nytt och ta ansvar. I arbetet är gott omdöme och förståelse för rättssäkerhet och säkerhet viktigt. Du ska också leva upp till vår medarbetarpolicy.
   

  

 I det här jobbet ska du:
   

  

* kunna skapa förtroende och ha mycket god samarbetsförmåga och bidra till ett positivt och entusiasmerande arbetsklimat för att nå gemensamma mål
* vara utvecklings- och lösningsorienterad, känna ansvar för att leverera bästa möjliga resultat, även i situationer då kravbilden är otydlig eller outtalad
* ha mycket god förmåga att kommunicera tydligt på svenska och engelska i tal och skrift, för att kunna förmedla komplicerad information vidare på ett enkelt och pedagogiskt sätt anpassad efter målgrupp
* kunna jobba självständigt och tillsammans med andra planera och driva arbetet framåt för att nå resultat på ett prestigelöst sätt
* vara resultatinriktad, genom att du bland annat formulerar mål, identifierar prioriteringar och visar på handlingskraft
* vara nyfiken, drivande och ha ett intresse för trender och vad som händer i omvärlden inom ditt ansvarsområde


 Du ska även ha:
   

  

* högskoleutbildning inom it alternativt flerårig arbetslivserfarenhet som arbetsgivaren bedömer relevant för rollen
* flerårig relevant och aktuell arbetslivserfarenhet av arkitektur inom it-säkerhet, informationssäkerhet alternativt signalskydd
* flerårig relevant och aktuell arbetslivserfarenhet av tjänstebaserad arkitektur
* flerårig aktuell och relevant erfarenhet av applikationsarkitektur på system alternativt enterprisenivå i en stor komplex it-miljö inom en stor organisation
* flerårig aktuell och relevant erfarenhet av att använda modeller för att analysera och dokumentera arkitektur
* dokumenterad kunskap i modern säkerhetsarkitektur


 Det är önskvärt att du har minst tre års erfarenhet av att arbeta i en organisation som levererar it-tjänster, infrastruktur eller it-drift. Det är också önskvärt att du har erfarenhet av att arbeta i agil förändring.
   

  

**Bra att veta**
 Anställningen är tillsvidare och kan inledas med provanställning i sex månader.
   

  

 En anställning hos oss kan innebära placering i säkerhetsklass. En säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585) kan därför komma att genomföras före beslut om anställning. För en del av våra arbetsuppgifter i säkerhetsklass krävs svenskt medborgarskap.
   

  

 På skatteverket.se/jobb kan du exempelvis läsa om vår samhällsbärande roll, fördelarna med att jobba hos oss och hur det går till när du söker våra jobb.
   

  

 När du ansöker bifogar du ditt cv. Vi använder inte personligt brev i våra rekryteringar och du ska därför inte bifoga det i din ansökan.
   

  

 Välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

 Skatteverket har en samhällsbärande roll. Vårt arbete berör alla privatpersoner och företag och genom vårt uppdrag bidrar vi till ett väl fungerande samhälle. Vår utveckling är kunddriven och vi samverkar med andra för att skapa effektiva lösningar. Tillsammans gör vi samhället möjligt.
   

  

 Anställningsform: tillsvidareanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100% | Ort: Sundbyberg | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: 2025/202 | Kontakt: Susanne Krieg, sektionschef susanne.krieg@skatteverket.se, Maria-Claudia Sun Han Cordova, hr-specialist maria-claudia.sun.han.cordova@skatteverket.se, | Facklig företrädare: Jeanette Forsgren, ST jeanette.forsgren@skatteverket.se, Göran Sundwall, Saco goran.sundwall@skatteverket.se, | Publicerat: 2025-03-14 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-04-07

title: IT Operations Project Manager
description:
**Why Join Us?**
 At Tobii Dynavox, we empower people with disabilities to do what they once did or never thought possible. We call this mission Power to Be You. Our assistive communication technology helps our customers express themselves, connect with the world, and pursue independence, whether through everyday activities like ordering food or extraordinary feats like running a company. Working at Tobii Dynavox, you’ll become part of a team that spans the globe, with offices in the US, Sweden, France, the UK, China, and beyond.
   

  

 To learn more about what we make possible, meet some of our customers or take a look at some of our solutions.
   

  

 We are seeking a versatile IT Operations Project Manager with experience in Microsoft 365 and Azure to join our team. The ideal candidate will be capable of running multiple projects in parallel, coordinating with various teams, and being hands-on with technical tasks. This role requires a proactive individual who can structure projects, manage timelines, and ensure effective communication across departments.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
* Project Management: Lead and manage multiple IT projects simultaneously, ensuring they are completed on time and within budget.
* Technical Expertise: Actively support projects with hands-on activities and knowledge.
* Coordination: Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including IT, sales, HR, and customer service, to ensure seamless project execution.
* Documentation: Maintain comprehensive project documentation, including project plans, status reports, and risk assessments.


**Qualifications:**
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field (or equivalent experience).
* Proven experience in IT operations management, preferably with a background in Microsoft 365 and Azure.
* Strong understanding of IT service management (ITSM) principles and best practices.
* Excellent leadership and team management skills with a proactive and engaging approach.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.
* Effective communication and interpersonal skills, promoting collaboration and understanding across diverse teams.


**Preferred Skills:**
* Experience with cloud platforms, network administration, and server management.
* Familiarity with IT security measures and compliance standards.
* Ability to work across different locations and time zones.


**Our Values:**
 At Tobii Dynavox, our mission guides what we do, and our values guide us in how we do it. Across the organization, we are committed to being Collaborative, Considerate, Curious and Courageous. We build a trusting environment where every team member prioritizes our customers with empathy and insight. Bold ideas and learning lead to impactful solutions. Driven by curiosity, we continuously challenge the status quo to create meaningful, customer-focused solutions for our customers.
   

  

**What We Offer:**
 At Tobii Dynavox, we believe in empowering individuals – including our employees - to reach their full potential. Here’s what makes us unique:
   

  

* Purpose-Driven Work: Join a company that transforms lives by giving a voice to those with communication challenges. Every day, your work makes a meaningful and concrete impact.
* “Yes, and...” Flexibility: Build a rewarding career AND enjoy time with loved ones. We offer flexible work options so you don’t have to choose between personal and professional goals.
* Growth and Development: Whether you’re advancing your skills or growing your career, we invest in your future with training, learning opportunities, and internal growth paths.
* Inclusive and Supportive Culture: Work in a collaborative, caring environment where diversity and individuality are valued. You’ll feel connected to both your team and our global community.
* A Global Leader with Heart: Be part of an innovative, forward-thinking company that combines experience and cutting-edge solutions with a mission to change lives.

title: Systemarkitekt
description:
Vill du vara med på Skatteverkets inre resa och bygga upp en säker, effektiv och ändamålsenlig arkitektur för våra interna processer för att driva Skatteverket framåt? Vi söker nu en systemarkitekt med kunskaper inom it-säkerhet till vår tågledning, som i huvudsak stödjer våra interna förmågor inom ledning, styrning och verksamhetsstöd. Är du en erfaren arkitekt som gillar att bygga upp arkitekturförmåga - då är det dig vi söker. Var med och gör samhället möjligt!
   

  

**Om jobbet**
 Genom effektiva digitala flöden ska vi förenkla arbetsdagen för alla medarbetare, ta bort onödiga administrativa moment och fortsätta stärka Skatteverkets varumärke som en attraktiv och modern arbetsgivare. Vi har ett starkt fokus på att effektivisera våra interna processer och behöver en långsiktig, säker och robust arkitektur där vi nyttjar verktygen optimalt. Vi är i uppbyggnaden av våra arkitekturförmågor och arkitekturstyrning samt vill fortsätta utveckla myndighetens it-säkerhetsarbete och it-säkerhetsstyrning inom vilket du också förväntas bidra.
   

  

 Vi utvecklar och förvaltar idag ett 40-tal olika system och tjänster som spänner över många olika tekniker, inköpta standardsystem, molntjänster och egen utvecklade produkter. Våra produkter betjänar i huvudsak våra verksamheter inom ledning, styrning och stöd men vi hanterar även delar i vår kärnverksamhet. Detta gör att vi har många leverantörer och intressenter mot vår verksamhet och därmed många kontakter både inom och utanför Skatteverket.
   

  

 Skatteverket har infört SAFe som agilt ramverk, och du jobbar tillsammans med team och övriga arkitekter som en del av tågledningen. Du omsätter verksamhetsbehoven till optimerade it-lösningar, bereder lösningsförslag inför beslut om anskaffningar eller ändringar, agerar bollplank och säkerställer att arkitekturprodukter som bland annat architectural runway, enablers och icke funktionella krav arbetas fram, implementeras och utvecklas.
   

  

 Skatteverkets it-avdelning ansvarar för drift, förvaltning och utveckling av myndighetens it-system och levererar idag it-drift till flera kunder. Vi arbetar för att vara Sveriges bästa it-driftleverantör för myndigheter vilket förutsätter samarbeten med arkitekter på andra myndigheter samt kännedom och tillämpning av nationellt framtagna arkitekturprodukter.
   

  

 På Skatteverket erbjuder vi dig utvecklingsmöjligheter både på djupet och på bredden. Du har flexibel arbetstid och det är en självklarhet för oss att du har balans mellan arbete och fritid. Du tillhör it-avdelningen och kommer vara placerad på vårt nybyggda och moderna kontor i Sundbyberg.
   

  

**Om dig**
 För att göra ett bra jobb och trivas hos oss på Skatteverket behöver du vara lyhörd, tänka nytt och ta ansvar. I arbetet är gott omdöme och förståelse för rättssäkerhet och säkerhet viktigt. Du ska också leva upp till vår medarbetarpolicy.
   

  

 I det här jobbet ska du:
   

  

* ha god samarbetsförmåga, vara hjälpsam och ha ett gott bemötande
* vara lösningsfokuserad och se till både gruppens och din egen prestation
* vara driven och har en förmåga att kunna engagera andra
* på ett överskådligt och pedagogiskt sätt kunna beskriva och illustrera lösningar och arkitektur anpassat till olika målgrupper och på en nivå som mottagaren förstår
* ha ett strukturerat arbetssätt och vara noggrann
* ha god kommunikationsförmåga i svenska, både i tal och skrift


 Du ska även ha:
   

  

* eftergymnasial utbildning eller flerårig arbetslivserfarenhet som arbetsgivaren bedömer relevant
* flerårig aktuell och relevant arbetslivserfarenhet som arkitekt i komplexa organisationer
* flerårig erfarenhet av integrationer och applikationer


 Det är önskvärt att du har erfarenhet av it-säkerhetsarkitektur och dess implementation. Det är även önskvärt om du har erfarenhet av att jobba som arkitekt med systemstöd så som HR och ekonomi. Vidare är det önskvärd om du har arbetat i agil utvecklingsverksamhet enligt SAFe och jobbat i offentlig verksamhet.
   

  

**Bra att veta**
 Anställningen är tillsvidare och kan inledas med provanställning i sex månader.
   

  

 En anställning hos oss kan innebära placering i säkerhetsklass. En säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585) kan därför komma att genomföras före beslut om anställning. För en del av våra arbetsuppgifter i säkerhetsklass krävs svenskt medborgarskap.
   

  

 På skatteverket.se/jobb kan du exempelvis läsa om vår samhällsbärande roll, fördelarna med att jobba hos oss och hur det går till när du söker våra jobb.
   

  

 När du ansöker bifogar du ditt cv. Vi använder inte personligt brev i våra rekryteringar och du ska därför inte bifoga det i din ansökan.
   

  

 Välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

 Skatteverket har en samhällsbärande roll. Vårt arbete berör alla privatpersoner och företag och genom vårt uppdrag bidrar vi till ett väl fungerande samhälle. Vår utveckling är kunddriven och vi samverkar med andra för att skapa effektiva lösningar. Tillsammans gör vi samhället möjligt.
   

  

 Anställningsform: tillsvidareanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100% | Ort: Sundbyberg | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: 2025/214 | Kontakt: Christina Sollenberg, sektionschef christina.sollenberg@skatteverket.se, Frida Hörnquist, hr-specialist frida.hornquist@skatteverket.se, | Facklig företrädare: Jeanette Forsgren, ST jeanette.forsgren@skatteverket.se, Göran Sundwall, Saco goran.sundwall@skatteverket.se, Therese Sjödin, Seko therese.sjodin@skatteverket.se, | Publicerat: 2025-03-14 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-04-03

title: Service Operations Manager
description:
**Join a Fast-Growing Company Revolutionizing the Storage Industry** 




  






 Are you ready to be at the forefront of transforming the real estate industry? As one of the first hires at our company, founded by serial entrepreneurs, you have a unique opportunity to shape a major international business that challenges the traditional storage category. We offer a role where your contributions will have a direct impact on our growth and innovation as we expand across Europe.
 




  






 Join us as a Service Operations Manager and take charge of our day-to-day operations. In this pivotal role, you will enhance customer satisfaction, tackle challenges at our storage sites and website, with the goal to ensure smooth central operations.
 




  






 The need for better solutions for storage has never been bigger - with fewer homes featuring built-in solutions, the demand for affordable, secure, and easily accessible storage alternatives is growing. Our mission is to fill this significant gap, and we need your proactive, hands-on leadership to make it happen.
 




  





**About the Role** 





 As the Service Operations Manager, you will be directly involved in managing operational tasks and processes, addressing customer inquiries, and resolving any challenges or issues that arise with our storage locations or e-commerce platform. You will work closely with the founders and the entire team to ensure the storage sites are functioning optimally and customers are supported across multiple channels. This position is highly versatile, and we expect you to be proactive to avoid problems from occurring, and hands-on in solving problems when they inevitably do occur. 
 




  





***Key responsibilities include:***



* Managing operational challenges at storage sites and ensuring centralized solutions are implemented.
* Select tooling and setup processes to run a smooth operation and minimize avoidable issues.
* Handling customer support and resolving any issues with our services.
* Be the central point of contact regarding our operations and ensure efficient communication between different teams and stakeholders.
* Identifying areas of improvement in the customer experience and proposing solutions that makes us faster and our customers happier.



  





**We are looking for someone with** 



* 2-3 years of experience from an operations, customer success, or project manager role
* Academic degree
* Proven track record of handling high number of tasks in parallel
* Previous experience in e-commerce and customer support is highly desirable.
* Structured, hands-on, and proactive approach to problem-solving.
* Ability to adapt to a fast-paced and dynamic work environment.
* Ability to manage a variety of tasks simultaneously and ensure smooth operations.
* Strong communication skills and the ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams.



  





**﻿
 
 More About Us** 





 We’re a company on the move, revolutionizing the self-storage market. With an expanding presence across Europe, we provide affordable and secure storage solutions that meet the needs of our customers. We’re looking for someone eager to contribute to our mission and help ensure that we continue to scale smoothly. If you're passionate about supporting operations and customer success, we'd love to hear from you. Please send your application and any questions you might have to careers@henriksson.com.

title: Founder's associate
description:
**Join a Fast-Growing Company Revolutionizing the Storage Industry** 




  






 Are you ready to be at the forefront of transforming the real estate industry? As one of the first hires at our company, founded by serial entrepreneurs, you have a unique opportunity to shape a major international business that challenges the traditional storage category. We offer a role where your contributions will have a direct impact on our growth and innovation as we expand across Europe.
 




  






 Join us as a Founder Associate and become a central part of building this business. This role will provide a wide range of fun challenges from the day-to-day operations of our storage business, to working on large deals and transactions. No task is too small or too complicated to tackle, and you’ll learn alongside a strong founder and investor team. 
 




  






 The need for better solutions for storage has never been bigger - with fewer homes featuring built-in solutions, the demand for affordable, secure, and easily accessible storage alternatives is growing. Our mission is to fill this significant gap, and we need your proactive, hands-on leadership to make it happen.
   






**About the Role** 





 As the Founder Associate, you will be directly involved in managing operational tasks, addressing customer inquiries, and resolving any challenges or issues that arise with our storage locations or e-commerce platform, both in Sweden and abroad. You will work closely with the entire team to ensure the business runs smoothly and issues are not only solved quickly when they arise, but seen ahead of time and proactively avoided. You will be one of our first employees and is expected to learn the ins and outs of the entire business and work proactively to push the company forward, and grow and take on responsibilities as the business grows. 
 




  





***Key responsibilities include:***



* Work on highly important, often urgent business issues as they arise.
* Support with structure, documentation and follow ups for key business decisions and processes.
* Help build structure and engage in our Operations Team in handling customer support and resolving any issues with our storage services
* Collaborate with the wider team on operational challenges at storage sites, take lead on identifying improvements  and ensuring centralized solutions are implemented.
* Ensuring efficient communication between different teams and stakeholders.
* Identifying areas of improvement in the customer experience, proposing and implementing solutions.
* Being a central point of contact for any operational matters.



  





**We are looking for someone with** 



* 2-3 years of work experience consultant, project manager or similar operations role
* Academic degree within business or engineering
* Previous experience in customer success related tasks and roles
* Structured, hands-on, and proactive approach to problem solving
* Ability to adapt to a fast-paced and dynamic work environment.
* Ability to analyze and identify areas of improvement and opportunity, and go from idea to practical implementation.
* Ability to manage a variety of tasks simultaneously and ensure smooth operations.
* Strong communication skills and the ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams.



  





**More About Us** 





 We’re a company on the move, revolutionizing the self-storage market. With an expanding presence across Europe, we provide affordable and secure storage solutions that meet the needs of our customers. We’re looking for someone eager to contribute to our mission and help ensure that we continue to scale smoothly. If you're passionate about supporting operations and customer success, we'd love to hear from you. Please send your application and any questions you might have to careers@henriksson.com.

title: Customer Service Agent - Sweden
description:
**Who We Are**
 Since our start in 2017, we've been on a mission to disrupt the status quo by arming individuals with savvy tools to reclaim control of their finances and debts– because we firmly believe that's where the power truly should lie, in the hands of our users. Every move we make is guided by a singular vision: to turbocharge the financial well-being of our customers.
   

  

 Thus far, we've provided financial easement for Swedes, Finns, Norwegians, and Germans, helping them pocket millions by reducing the interest rates on consumer credit and giving high interest rates kick to the curb. But we're not stopping here; we're hungry for more. We're eyeing new frontiers, fresh products, and in general aiming to revolutionize financial empowerment. As an Operations Agent, you're not just joining a team – you're diving into a wild ecosystem where innovation reigns supreme, surrounded by comrades who are relentless, adaptable, and hell-bent on delivering nothing short of stellar service.
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
 We firmly believe that everyone deserves a shot at financial freedom, and assisting our users in wrangling their debts remains our top priority. In this role, you'll not only bolster our existing efforts but also unearth new tactics to keep up with the ever-evolving needs of our users. Naturally, you'll rally alongside an amazing team across various fronts, but beyond that, you'll be at the forefront of our crusade, leading the charge in shaping a culture of innovation and collaboration in a high-octane environment. And if that's not enough, buckle up for a rollercoaster ride of responsibilities, including:
   

  

* Providing clear and concise service, both in the written and spoken word.
* Drawing from the trenches of your experience in customer service or support roles to tackle inquiries and quash concerns like a pro.
* Analyzing and dissecting complex credit applications, all while sticking to our credit policies like glue.
* Taking on the mantle of assessing worthy candidates for debt refinancing with gusto.
* Pitching in to finesse our processes and take our customer care game to the next level.


**Who You Are**
 In order to succeed in this role we believe that you have:
   

  

* Battle scars from previous roles in customer service or support roles, ideally in a similar capacity.
* A hunger for numbers and a knack for untangling tricky problems.
* Fluency in Swedish and English


 And maybe, just maybe…
   

  

* A battle-hardened 1-2 years of experience in credit assessment.


**What We Offer You**
 An epicenter of energy and innovation nestled in the beating heart of Stockholm, complete with a rockstar company culture and enough breakfasts, after-work bashes, and stocked refreshments to keep you fueled for the revolution 😎
   

  

 Being part of an awesome team, guided by a fearless Team Manager who's seen it all.
   

  

 Enough vacation days to make the Nine Realms jealous, top-tier tech gear, health and wellness perks to keep you fighting fit for the battles ahead.
   

  

 And not least a chance to carve your name into the annals of financial history, shaping and elevating our customer experience.
   

  

 Work Hours: Flexible schedules fit for warriors, with options for either 8-17 or 9-18 on weekdays.
   

  

 Location: Right smack dab in the throbbing heart of Stockholm City.
   

  

 Start Date: Yesterday! But hey, we'll settle for ASAP.
   

  

 Anyfin is a fintech on a mission to simplify loan repayments and improve the financial well-being of millions. We help consumers reduce the costs of high-interest loans, and take control of their repayment plan.

title: Consultancy: Knowledge Management & Country Office Support - Office of Innovation, Stockholm, Sweden (13 months)
description:
UNICEF works in some of the world’s toughest places, to reach the world’s most disadvantaged children. To save their lives. To defend their rights. To help them fulfill their potential.
   

  

 Across 190 countries and territories, we work for every child, everywhere, every day, to build a better world for everyone.
   

  

 And we never give up.
   

  

**For every child...innovate**
 UNICEF has a 70-year history of innovating for children. We believe that new approaches, partnerships and technologies that support realizing children’s rights are critical to improving their lives.
   

  

 The Office of Innovation is a creative, interactive, and agile team in UNICEF. We sit at a unique intersection, where an organization that works on huge global issues meets the start-up thinking, the technology, and the partners that turn this energy into scalable solutions.
   

  

 UNICEF's Office Of Innovation Creates Opportunities For The World's Children By Focusing On Where New Markets Can Meet Their Vital Needs. We Do This By
   

  

* Connecting youth communities (or more broadly -- anyone disconnected or under-served) to decision-makers, and to each other, to deliver informed, relevant and sustained programmes that build better, stronger futures for children.
* Provoking change for children through an entrepreneurial approach -- in a traditionally risk averse field -- to harness rapidly moving innovations and apply them to serve the needs of all children.
* Creating new models of partnership that leverage core business values across the public, private and academic sectors in order to deliver fast, and lasting results for children.


**Our team**
 We're An Interdisciplinary Team Around The World Tasked With Identifying, Prototyping, And Scaling New Technologies And Practices. With Our Partners, We Focus On Convening And Collaborating On New And Different Solutions, Low- And High-tech, By
   

  

* Looking at the 2–5-year horizon to evaluate emerging and trending technologies and to see how UNICEF can work with the private sector on doing better business while improving essential services for children.
* Investing in early-stage solutions that show great potential to positively impact children in the 2-year future including the Venture Fund that invests in open-source technology solutions from start-ups based in UNICEF’s programme countries.
* Identifying proven solutions that can be implemented at national scale in multiple countries – taking the ideas that help thousands in one country, bringing them to dozens of countries across multiple sectors, and impacting the lives of millions of children.”


**How can you make a difference?**
 The Knowledge Management and CO Support Consultant is expected to support several capacity-building initiatives, including the Spark Accelerator and COMPASS.
   

  

**Your Main Responsibilities Will Be**
 Detailed responsibilities / deliverables.
   

  

**Main Responsibilities**
* Innovation knowledge capture & curation – Coordinate and establish processes to systematically identify, document, and synthesize best practices, lessons learned, and emerging insights related to Spark innovations, Compass and capacity building initiatives, supporting the preparation of case studies, learning briefs, think pieces, articles or other user-friendly products and promoting joined-up knowledge generation addressing knowledge gaps
* Facilitate cross learning on innovation – Design, develop, and maintain accessible knowledge-sharing platforms and tailor capacity building initiatives to inform decision-making and scale impact, ensuring UNICEF country offices and partners can easily access relevant innovation resources, tools, and case studies.
* Package and disseminate innovation offerings – Define, refine, and communicate innovation services to country offices, ensuring clarity on available support, resources, and engagement opportunities.
* Resource mobilization – Identify and pursue funding opportunities to sustain and scale innovation initiatives across UNICEF, including supporting pipeline development and donor engagement. Lead the creation of compelling proposals, concept notes, and funding pitches, aligning UNICEF’s innovation priorities with donor interests, and support donor project reporting requirements and information management between donors, internal stakeholders and project leads.
* Innovation community engagement and Innovation Awards – Foster active participation in knowledge-sharing networks, discussion forums, and internal/external innovation communities to strengthen collaboration and learning, hence promoting knowledge sharing channels and an innovation learning community. Recognize outstanding contributions to innovation practices.
* Event support and thought leadership – Identify stories and major communication moments that showcase the impact of the OOI’s work and contribute to innovation events and workshops, ensuring effective dissemination of insights and fostering strategic dialogues with partners.


**For more details, preview review the Terms of Reference:** 
**TOR Consultant KM & CO Support (06032025).docx**
**To qualify as an advocate for every child you will have…**
* A university degree in Social Sciences, Humanities, Business, Design or other relevant field.
* A minimum of seven years of relevant professional experience in areas such as knowledge management, innovation, partnerships, communications, reporting and/or resource mobilization-related positions.
* Five years of experience at the national and international levels in programme management and knowledge management is desired.
* Experience working in the international development/humanitarian sectors and experience working in developing countries is required.
* Experience in working with multiple countries and with multiple stakeholders. High capacity for organization and coordination, as well as an ability to establish effective working relations and work with a high degree of collaboration with various type of teams.
* Experience influencing and driving corporate change initiatives.
* Strong written and verbal communication skills.
* Previous work experience with UN agencies is a plus.
* Developing country work experience and/or familiarity with emergency is considered an asset.
* Fluency in English is required; strong written and verbal competency is necessary.


**Travel**
* Trips may be required based on the 2025-2026 work plans. For these trips, the Consultant does not need to include an estimated duty-related travel budget as part of the all-inclusive fee.
