* Experience managing cross-functional teams and track record of operational excellence


**What we offer colleagues**
 We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognise outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus or commission. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.
   

  

* Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
* Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
* Annual compensation review
* Recognition rewards
* Annual holiday leave
* Maternity and paternity leave
* Employee Assistance Programme
* Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
* Priority Pass, and travel upgrades for long haul company events


**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world of software. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Most colleagues at Canonical have worked from home since its inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.
   

  

 Canonical is an equal opportunity employer
   

  

 We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

title: Senior Network Architect
description:
Cambio is one of the Nordics' leading suppliers in e-health with a comprehensive offering for the entire health and care chain. Our e-health solutions support healthcare professionals in their daily work and offer patients safer and more easily accessible care. We are proud to be an important part of Swedish health and social care. We are growing continuously and now have about 1000 employees in several countries.
   

  

**The position**
 As a
 **Senior Network Architect** 
 at Cambio IT Operations and Infrastructure, you will play a key role in designing, implementing, and maintaining secure and scalable network architectures. Your expertise in WAN, LAN, segmentation, and microsegmentation will be essential in ensuring high-performance, resilient, and secure network solutions. You will collaborate with internal teams and external partners to deliver and maintain enterprise-level network and security infrastructure.
   

  

**Your Responsibilities Include**
* Designing, implementing, and maintaining highly available and secure enterprise network solutions.
* Driving network segmentation and microsegmentation strategies to enhance security and performance.
* Supporting and optimizing WAN/LAN infrastructure across multiple locations.
* Working closely with security teams to enforce best practices and compliance requirements.
* Evaluating and recommending network and security technologies to improve efficiency and security posture.
* Implementing and managing network automation to enhance efficiency and reliability.
* Documenting solutions, operational processes, and maintenance procedures.
* Collaborating cross-functionally with internal teams and external vendors to support business requirements.


 Cambio is a company with employees from many countries, with many cultural backgrounds and creeds. We think that you share our belief that this diversity is a key building block in creating successful teams. Our culture is described through the words “Trust”, “Care” and “Together” which permeate everything we do.
   

  

**About You**
 You are a strategic thinker and a hands-on problem solver with a deep understanding of enterprise networking. You are passionate about designing secure and scalable network architectures and stay up to date with emerging network technologies. You work collaboratively across teams and are comfortable engaging with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
   

  

**Requirements** 
  

  

* Extensive experience in network architecture, administration, and deployment.
* Deep knowledge of WAN, LAN, network segmentation, and microsegmentation.
* Strong experience with datacenter networking and infrastructure design.
* Experience with network automation to streamline operations and reduce manual tasks.
* Familiarity with Infrastructure as Code (IaC) and GitOps methodologies.
* Well-organized and experienced in creating solution designs, operational, and maintenance documentation.
* Strong analytical and troubleshooting skills.
* Ability to communicate fluently in both Swedish and English.


**It's a bonus if you have**
* Experience with network monitoring platforms and tools.
* Industry certifications such as CCNP, MCSA, or equivalent.
* ITIL knowledge and experience.


**Place of employment** 
 : Linköping or Stockholm.
   

  

 At Cambio we value a healthy work-life balance, and to encourage that we apply a hybrid working-model. Together with your team you decide which days you work at the office. On the remaining days you can work remotely from home, but you are always more than welcome to work at the office too.
   

  

**Scope** 
 : Full time
   

  

**Form of employment:** 
 Permanent employment, 6 months trial period
   

  

**Other** 
**:** 
 Due to the sensitivity of the data handled, background checks will be conducted on the final candidate.
   

  

 We screen the applications and hold interviews continuously so please send your application as soon as possible via the link.
   

  

 We encourage and eagerly welcome all applications, but we will only consider candidates who are located and have the legal right to work in
 **Sweden.** 
 We will ask for verification during the process.
   

  

**We look forward to receiving your application!**
 Read more about us
 **here!**
 Are you interested in Cambio but you don’t feel that this position is the perfect match? Check out our other open positions at the career site
 **here!**
 Cambio Healthcare Systems is Sweden’s leading suppliers of healthcare information systems and a growing player in the European market with just over 100,000 users across general and university hospitals, specialist units and outpatient units. Through the use of our integrated solutions, our customers provide services to 4 million patients.

title: IT-arkitekt -AMF i Stockholm
description:
**Vi söker en IT-arkitekt som vill driva effektiva och hållbara lösningar med och för AMF i Stockholm!**
 Vi drivs enligt ömsesidiga principer, vilket betyder att all vinst går tillbaka till våra kunder. Vill du som vi se våra kunders pensioner att växa genom att göra smarta och kostnadseffektiva val. Här har du en central roll där du påverkar AMFs IT-landskap och arbetar med både strategiska initiativ och operativa lösningar.
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig**
* Ett meningsfullt uppdrag där du bidrar till att skapa trygghet för miljontals pensionssparare genom att utveckla stabila och kostnadseffektiva IT-lösningar
* En arbetsgivare med en tydlig ambition att arbeta hållbart, vilket genomsyrar både investeringar och verksamhetens utveckling
* En roll med stort mandat, frihet och påverkansmöjligheter där du tillhör vår centrala arkitektfunktion där alla arkitekturella beslut för AMF tas
* En stabil och långsiktig arbetsgivare - AMF är ett av Sveriges största pensionsbolag och erbjuder en trygg arbetsplats med långsiktiga karriärmöjligheter
* Balansera arbete och fritid med flexibilitet, inklusive möjlighet till visst distansarbete


**Det här gör du hos oss**
 Som IT-arkitekt på AMF har du en central roll i att vara med och utveckla ett modernt och kostnadseffektivt IT-landskap som möter både dagens och framtida. Du arbetar med en mix av egenutvecklade och standardlösningar, alltid med fokus på långsiktighet och hållbarhet. Rollen innebär nära samarbete med andra arkitekter, utvecklingsteam och verksamhetsansvariga för att säkerställa att IT-strategi och målarkitektur realiseras.
   

  

**Du Kommer Bland Annat**
* Vara med och utveckla målarkitektur
* Medverka och i vissa fall leda arbetet i inledande faser i nya initiativ
* Genomföra analyser och ta fram rekommendationer och beslutsunderlag
* Driva eller medverka i framtagande av övergripande lösningsförslag och säkerställa att de är långsiktiga, förvaltningsbara och kostnadseffektiva.
* Kontinuerligt effektivisera och förenkla IT-landskapet
* Vara med och utveckla arkitekturfunktionen tillsammans med övriga arkitekter
* Ta fram och säkerställa att relevant arkitekturdokumentation finns på plats.
* Vara involverad i övergripande arkitekturfrågor och operativt arbete i att realisera IT-lösningar


**Ditt team och arbetsplats**
 Du blir en del av AMF:s arkitekturfunktion som består av verksamhets-, informations- och IT-arkitekter. Vårt team präglas av samarbete, och vi har höga ambitioner både för våra lösningar och för hur vi arbetar tillsammans. Du kommer att vara en central punkt för AMF och samarbeta med AMF på alla nivåer.
   

  

 Vi sitter i trevliga lokaler centralt i Stockholm nära T-centralen. Vi arbetar agilt enligt SAFe med PI-planering och tvåveckorssprintar.
   

  

**Mer om dig**
 Vi söker dig som har flera års erfarenhet att design och realisera IT-lösningar och du känner dig trygg med att leda arkitekturarbete tillsammans med andra för att skapa kostnadseffektiva, skalbara och långsiktigt hållbara IT-lösningar. Du har flera års erfarenhet av att arbeta som IT arkitekt och att utveckla IT-lösningar som möter verksamhetens behov utifrån applikations- och integrationsarkitektur. Du har även erfarenhet av olika standardtjänster/applikationer. Har du erfarenhet av hybridmiljöer med både on-prem och molnlösningar är det ett stort plus.
   

  

 Vi tror att du är en analytisk och strukturerad person som tar ansvar för att driva arkitekturarbetet framåt. Genom din kommunikativa förmåga och ditt engagemang får du med dig intressenter och säkerställer att strategiska beslut blir verklighet.
   

  

 Du är van att kommunicera med olika målgrupper och använder modeller och dokumentation för att visualisera arkitekturens riktning. Dessutom har du en förmåga att bryta ner problem och presentera dem på ett tydligt och pedagogiskt sätt för olika intressenter.
   

  

**Intresserad?**
 I den här rekryteringen har vi valt att samarbeta med Ada Digital som strävar efter en transparent, inkluderande och snabbrörlig rekryteringsupplevelse. Vi vill veta mer om dig och din potential! Du söker tjänsten enkelt och behöver inte bifoga några dokument. Det räcker med en motivering till varför du söker tjänsten och om du saknar CV kan du bifoga din LinkedIn-profil. Följ sedan din ansökan live via vår hemsida. Urvalet sker löpande och tjänsten kan bli tillsatt före sista ansökningsdatum. Är du nyfiken och vill veta mer innan du söker? Hör av dig till ansvarig rekryterare. Vi ser fram emot att få kontakt med dig!

title: System Engineer SME
description:
Choosing Capgemini means choosing a company where you will be empowered to shape your career in the way you’d like, where you’ll be supported and inspired by a collaborative community of colleagues around the world, and where you’ll be able to reimagine what’s possible. Join us and help the world’s leading organizations unlock the value of technology and build a more sustainable, more inclusive world.
   

  

**YOUR ROLE**
 As a System Engineer SME, you have an important role, being at front to help our clients create the sustainable, inclusive future we all want and need. Going beyond designing IT systems to deliver business change while securing sustainability. Our System Engineers provide top level business and technology consultancy services to our clients and we are now seeking out next colleague!
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
* Manage and optimize virtualization and Mainframe environments
* Install, configure, and manage Windows Server OS and Active Directory
* Ensure security, stability, and compliance of systems
* Monitor and optimize system performance
* Troubleshoot and resolve issues
* Design and maintain virtualization environments
* Provide technical support and manage user access
* Perform user onboarding and off boarding processes, including account creations, access provisioning, and software installations
* Participate in MIM and P1 & P2 issues
* Provide consulting in case technical advice is required.
* Perform routine maintenance tasks, such as system updates, patches, and backups
* Maintain IT documentation, including system configurations, procedures, and user guides
* Reviewing system error logs and user-reported errors


**YOUR PROFILE**
**Key Qualifications:**
* Strong knowledge of Window operating systems
* Proficiency in roles like Active Directory, DNS, DHCP, File Services, DFS and Print Services
* Experience in various ticketing tools(Snow, effecta … etc) & ITIL/Agile process
* Familiarity with networking concepts, protocols, and services, including TCP/IP, DHCP, DNS, and VPN
* Understanding of security best practices and experience in implementing security measures on Window systems
* Monitor system performance and respond to alerts
* Experience in working on critical production incidents by maintaining SLA
* Strong hold on Patch Management, Application deployment and compliance through SCCM Tool
* Strong knowledge in PowerShell script Writing & execution
* Knowledge of Remote Desktop Services as well as RDS web server management.
* Strong verbal and written skills, preferable in both Swedish and English
* Proven experience as a Hyper-V / VMware and Windows Administrator with expertise in virtualization technologies
* Microsoft certifications such as MCSE: Core Infrastructure or equivalent
* Excellent problem-solving and troubleshooting skills
* Minimum 12+ years of hands-on experience


**WHAT YOU’LL LOVE ABOUT WORKING HERE:**
* A challenging career in a vibrant environment with access to extensive training and a global network of experts
* Opportunities to work on real-world problems and help transform leading organizations
* A company culture driven by core values: Honesty, Trust, Freedom, Team Spirit, Modesty, Fun, and Boldness
* A strong commitment to inclusion, diversity, and supporting the whole person
* An innovative culture that promotes learning, growth, and shared success


 Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fuelled by its market leading capabilities in AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem. The Group reported 2023 global revenues of €22.5 billion.

title: Energy Projects Manager, Infrastructure Energy Team
description:
**Description**
 This position is available in: Stockholm, Dublin, London. Please submit your CV in Eng.
   

  

 As part of AWS’ EMEA Energy & Water team, the AWS Infrastructure Energy Team (IET) for Europe, Middle East and Africa (EMEA) is looking for a results-oriented individual to join in the role of Energy Projects Manager. This role owns the end-to-end power scaling strategy for a number of countries within the EMEA footprint. The role’s scope extends to analyzing, developing and implementing strategies on how we interconnect our data centers and how we can scale our business across the power grids on which we depend. The ultimate deliverable of the role is to ensure that access to secure, resilient and scalable power is maintained across the 2-3 countries you will have responsibility for so as not to constrain AWS business growth for our customers.
   

  

 With a proven track record in the power/energy sector, complemented by a robust project management skillset, you will own the origination and contracting of power capacity in partnership with regional experts. This will see you look round corners in anticipation of risks and barriers to growth, deep diving the quality of the power system and the underpinning generation and developing tactical solutions and strategic proposals to navigate constraints in terms of access to power. By delivering on the strategies you develop, you will enable scalable future growth to support the expansion of AWS Cloud, enabling our customers to innovate faster.
   

  

 In conjunction with partner teams, the successful candidate will cultivate business and technical relationships with a variety of stakeholders, including grid and electricity utilities, regulators and policymakers to ensure that power can be secured in a timely and economic manner to support AWS’s EMEA infrastructure expansion.
   

  

 AWS Infrastructure Services (AIS)
   

  

 AWS Infrastructure Services owns the design, planning, delivery, and operation of all AWS global infrastructure. In other words, we’re the people who keep the cloud running. We support all AWS data centers and all of the servers, storage, networking, power, and cooling equipment that ensure our customers have continual access to the innovation they rely on. We work on the most challenging problems, with thousands of variables impacting the supply chain — and we’re looking for talented people who want to help.
   

  

 You’ll join a diverse team of software, hardware, and network engineers, supply chain specialists, security experts, operations managers, and other vital roles. You’ll collaborate with people across AWS to help us deliver the highest standards for safety and security while providing seemingly infinite capacity at the lowest possible cost for our customers. And you’ll experience an inclusive culture that welcomes bold ideas and empowers you to own them to completion.
   

  

 Key job responsibilities
   

  

* You will work with real estate and planning teams, lead the development and execution of a comprehensive power growth strategy for AWS’s EMEA data centers for new and existing regions
* You will prospect for, originate and contract the power capacity needed to support the delivery of data centers
* You will identify risks in the delivery and operation of power grids and identify appropriate mitigations in collaboration with partner teams
* You will identify and develop cost saving projects and initiatives related to grid and network infrastructure
* You will collaborate with electricity utilities and other external stakeholders to develop strategies that support AWS’s expansion in EMEA
* You will work with AWS’s Public Policy team to develop policies and guidelines that enable broader AWS strategies and objectives


 A day in the life
   

  

* Leverages project management skills to manage both internal business partners and energy stakeholders
* Drives tactical execution of power contracts and initiatives
* Establishes and grows business and technical relationships, managing the day-to-day interactions with these partners
* Meeting the energy team objectives to support AWS’s EMEA infrastructure expansion


**About The Team**
 ABOUT THE TEAM
   

  

 The Infrastructure Energy team is currently a team of 13, with members of the team currently based in Dublin (Ireland), London (England), Madrid (Spain), Dubai (UAE) and Frankfurt (Germany). The team is responsible for originating, contracting and delivering reliable power connections to our DCs across EMEA. The work of the team is divided across a team of Energy Project Managers (EPMs) and Grid Delivery Managers (GDMs), supported by business analysts. The EPMs prospect for, originate and secure the power needed for AWS’s fleet of data centres while the GDMs lead the delivery of large-scale HV & MV infrastructure connections to our data centres. Finding reliable, scalable, sustainable power is one of the big challenges facing AWS today and into the future. The Infrastructure Energy team is key to meeting this challenge and enabling scalable future growth to support the expansion of AWS Cloud and our customers to innovate faster.
   

  

**About Aws**
 Diverse Experiences
   

  

 Amazon values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
   

  

 Why AWS
   

  

 Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
   

  

 Work/Life Balance
   

  

 We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve in the cloud.
   

  

 Inclusive Team Culture
   

  

 Here at AWS, it’s in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.
   

  

 Mentorship and Career Growth
   

  

 We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
   

  

**Basic Qualifications**
* Bachelor's Degree in Electrical or Power Engineering or other relevant technical field or equivalent professional or technical qualification
* 7-10+ years delivery track record in the electric utility/energy industry in an engineering, project or technical role including, but not limited to, deep understanding of the grid application process, grid access rules and electricity grids; understanding of the underlying policy and regulatory environment and extensive project management experience
* Ability to manage multiple simultaneous projects requiring frequent communication, organization, time management and problem-solving skills
* Proven track record for cultivating strong relationships with key clients and external stakeholders that have resulted in high customer satisfaction
* Working proficiency in the Swedish and English languages, both written and spoken


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Master’s Degree in relevant discipline (MBA/MS)
* Project Management Professional (PMP) or equivalent
* Experience designing, developing & delivering HV / MV electric infrastructure
* Experience of IT infrastructure, data centres and cloud services
* Ability to converse in German, French or Italian is advantageous
* Experience working on energy policy initiatives


 Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.
   

  

 Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers.
