title: Data Engineer
description:
*Lendo is looking for a Data Engineer to join our Data & Machine Learning team and help us take our data infrastructure to the next level.*
**The role**
 Be part of a team where data transforms ideas into real impact. As a Data Engineer, you will help build scalable solutions that turn information into insights, enabling smarter decisions across the company. In a collaborative and growth-focused environment, you’ll work with experts in engineering, machine learning, and analytics to develop efficient, high-quality and reliable data infrastructure. If you enjoy solving challenges and creating meaningful solutions, this role may be a great fit for you.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Design, build, and maintain scalable, robust, and reliable data pipelines and ETL processes to ingest, process, and transform datasets from various sources.
* Optimize data storage, processing, and retrieval for analytics, marketing, and machine learning applications.
* Ensure that business users (e.g., analysts, marketers, and finance teams) have reliable, well-structured, and timely access to data to support decision-making.
* Ensure data quality, integrity, and governance across our data ecosystem.
* Work closely with software engineers to build near-real-time data ingestion and feature store.
* Implement monitoring and logging solutions to track and manage data pipeline health and performance.
* Collaborate with data scientists, analysts, and other teams to enable analytics and model development.
* Contribute to best practices in data engineering and data management.

title: Full Stack Developer Digital Product Development Pricing Team
description:
***Are you passionate about building and growing impactful products in a collaborative and innovative environment? Join our team as a full-stack developer, where you'll work on a strategic core product, leverage cutting-edge technologies like C#/.NET Core and cloud solutions, and be part of a talented team that values growth and innovation!***
**This is what makes the position as Full Stack Developer unique**
* Play a key role in shaping a strategic product that drives the company's success.
* Take ownership of an evolving product with opportunities for continuous development and innovation.
* Collaborate with a talented and supportive team that values growth and teamwork.


 The hiring manager for this role is
 **Arnoud Rebel, Manager, Portals & Pricing** 
 . As a leader, he is dedicated to enabling personal and professional growth, leading with empathy, and fostering an open and supportive environment where every team member can thrive.
   

  

***Read more about Dustin here***
**Your role & influence as** 
**Full Stack Developer**
***Responsibility* 
 :** 
 In this role, you will be given responsibility for full-stack development within a collaborative, cross-functional team, focusing on enhancing and growing a strategic product while collaborating closely with fellow developers.
   

  

***Collaboration* 
 :** 
 Together with your team, you take care of building, maintaining, and developing a core product, collaborating closely not only with your immediate team members but also with the Digital Product Development department.
   

  

**Core Activities**
* Develop and maintain the core product.
* Enhance and grow the product through continuous improvements.


**Benefits Of Joining Dustin**
 We believe there's more to Dustin than just the benefits listed here. You'll fully understand this once you're with us.
   

  

**You can find more on our benefits below in the vacancy.**
****This is what we imagine you bring****
 We envision you as a curious, open-minded, and driven problem-solver with a strong team focus and a commitment to continuous learning. You thrive on developing and enhancing products, leveraging your expertise developed through minimum 5 years of experience with C# and .NET Core, relational databases/SQL, and building REST APIs, while embracing cloud technologies like Azure or AWS to drive innovation.
   

  

*Additionally, it'll be nice to see that you have experience with:*
* Javascript/node.js
* React


****What can you expect next?****
 To Ensure a Fair Recruitment Process Free From Unconscious Bias, We Handle Your Application Anonymously And Do Not Accept Cover Letters. Please Refrain From Sending One, So That The Selection Is Based Solely On Professional Competencies. We Expect The Following Steps In The Recruitment Process
   

  

* Telephone screening with Talent Acquisition Partner, Karishma
* First interview with Hiring Manager, Arnoud and another future colleague.
* Code Assignment and a Second (Technical) interview with two future colleagues.
* Professional references


**About**
**Read more about how to become a** 
**Dustineer**
 For questions about the position, please contact the TA Partner Karishma Sindhu via e-mail: karishma.sindhu@dustin.com

title: Senior Back End/Fullstack Engineers - Ruby - PostgresSQL
description:
Senior Backend/Fullstack Product Engineers — Ruby & PostgresSQL — Stockholm — Super Flexible on How/Where You Work — Up to 90k SEK/month + Equity
 



  





 Want to help shape our client’s platform’s future? findrtech are super please to be partnered with a fast-growing startup embedded in the business automation space, looking to hire senior backend/fullstack (either is fine) product engineers who love building well-tested, high-quality systems — and have ambitions to lead.
 



  





 Their close-knit group of engineers manages everything, continuously improving and scaling the platform. If you enjoy working in a collaborative environment that values passion and trust, you’ll fit right in.
 



  





 They’re cloud-native, with a tech stack including Ruby, Ruby on Rails, React, Node, GraphQL, Postgres, AWS, and some other bits and pieces. They’re looking for engineers with 5+ years of Ruby and a solid grasp of Postgres optimisation. Frontend experience with React would be a nice bonus, but definitely not a deal breaker — any GraphQL or AWS experience would be super useful.
 



  





 You’ll join a team of around 10 engineers, with plans to grow to at least 17. The structure is flat, and the opportunities are huge. It’s an exciting time to join a startup where both you and the product have unlimited potential.
 



  





 Why Apply? What’s in It for You?
 



  





 Apart from the above....
 



  




* Flexible work — choose how and where you work
* Generous equity — have a piece of the pizza from day one 🍕
* 6 weeks paid vacation
* Pick your own equipment via their platform
* Private healthcare and pension at ITP1 levels
* Central Stockholm location
* A supportive, fast-moving team with plenty of growth opportunities
* Super cool and chilled bunch to work with



  





 For more info and full transparency on company details, and to set up a call, email me at mark@findrtech.io - head over to the findrtech.io website for more info on what we do and who we've partnered with.

title: Systems Programmer
description:
We are looking for a Systems Programmer to join our Central Tech team! This is where our core technology team is based and where we innovate in areas that push the boundaries for what open-world sandbox gaming means as well as improve, optimize and support our existing core technology. In this role, you will work side by side with seasoned professionals with years of experience in developing our proprietary engine and runtime systems. Together, we will design solutions and elevate our engine to new heights!
   

  

**The position**
 As a Systems Programmer at Central Tech, you will help develop, maintain and adapt the lower-level systems of the game such as spawning, memory management, job scheduling, threading framework, frame layout, streaming, and networking interfaces. You will be involved in profiling and optimizing our game as well as assisting with debugging and the design of core systems. You should have a strong sense for developing simple, robust and performant systems. In addition to outstanding technical knowledge, we are looking for a self-motivated individual with strong communication and collaboration skills.
   

  

**What You'll Do**
* Work with Avalanche’s Central Technology team to develop core technology for our in-house open-world engine.
* Work with our systems to make them as efficient as possible.
* Debug, optimize and iterate our current technology.
* Work closely with the game projects in developing our engine to run on the first-party platforms.
* Support game projects using our in-house engine.


**Who You Are**
* Solid C++ programming experience.
* Excellent in problem-solving and debugging C++ code.
* Knowledge of a wide range of tools and pipelines used in modern game development.
* Strong multi-threaded programming skills.
* Knowledge of a wide range of game-level systems, including scene management, physics, animation, AI, rendering, etc.
* Experienced with automated testing, testable code, and robust test frameworks to ensure stability and performance.
* Have a great attention to detail.


*Note: Research shows under-represented groups in the industry (especially women) might not apply to a job if they don’t check off every requirement. At Avalanche, we’re more about your drive to learn and interest in tackling challenges than what’s on your resume! So don’t stress if you don’t tick every box— shoot us your application anyway! Diverse opinions and different experiences are what make our teams so great, not itemized lists of qualifications.*
**The Stockholm location**
 Our Stockholm office is situated in Södermalm, the beating heart of the city’s game industry. It’s a physical representation of our games – the lush vegetation of Just Cause and theHunter: Call of the Wild meets corroded metal straight out of Mad Max. It has everything you need to make it your creative base camp.
   

  

**Our values**
 At Avalanche Studios Group, we create worlds beyond limits. But that’s not exclusive to our games, so we’re committed to developing a diverse and inclusive workplace. All Avalanchers have a shared responsibility to create an open work environment where everyone is treated equally and respectfully. Being part of our world is not contingent on your heritage, your gender, or sexual orientation. It’s all about your passion and creativity.
   

  

**How To Apply**
 To apply for this position, please register below and provide your CV in English. We review applications continuously. All further studio-related information is provided under a non-disclosure agreement.
   

  

*At Avalanche Studios Group we're always on the lookout for talented individuals to join our passionate team, but please not that relocation assistance is not available for this role.*

title: Software engineer to Economic Crime Prevention –  PEGA & Cloud
description:
Are you passionate about software development and have experience in building in the PEGA platform? Do you also want to be a part of and contribute to our Cloud-journey? If so, we are eager to have you joining our team.
 



 In Swedbank you have the opportunity to:
 * Work in an innovative environment where clear strategic directions and priorities align with expectations.


* Conduct your work in an agile way, ensuring that we efficiently develop the right things and improve continuously.


* Develop new functionalities, corrections of defects as well as upholding production stability and support.


* Conduct quality activities and other essential tasks essential for high product quality throughout the development cycle.


* Collaborate with a team of talented architects, developers, business analysts and testers who all work closely with product owners and scrum masters.


 What is needed in this role:
 * Hands-on experience of developing and implementing PEGA solutions.


* Good understanding of integration patterns like SOAP, REST and microservices is beneficial.
* Experience from working within PEGA frameworks.


* Certified in CSA and CSSA is a clear advantage.
* Very good knowledge of implementing solution in Microsoft Azure or other Cloud-platforms.


* Very good knowledge in common engineering practices like continuous delivery and code reviews.
* Experience in OpenShift CLI commands is considered an advantage.


* Experience with the technologies such as MySQL, Oracle and Kafka are considered an advantage.


* You are a self-driven individual who possess a proactive mindset and are focused on finding solutions.


* You have excellent communication and coordination skills.


* Finally, you should have a relevant university degree.


 With us, you can experience:
 * Personal and professional growth through self-leadership and continuous development.
* Meaningful work that positively impacts our workplace, our customers, and society.
* An open and collaborative culture that encourages cross-functional teamwork and provides networking opportunities.
* A supportive and inclusive environment that promotes a balanced and sustainable work-life, with flexible working conditions when suitable for the role.
* Benefits such as our share based reward program Eken, company pension plan, employee offer for banking products, health insurance.






 "Join our team and...
 
 become part of an international team of professional colleagues, who work together to deliver challenging projects, maximize customer satisfaction and contribute to Swedbank's position in society."
 **Charlotte Häggroth, your future manager**



 We look forward to receiving your application by 28.03.2025. We work with continuous selection, which means that the position may be filled before the application deadline.
 
**Location:** 
 Sundbyberg, Stockholm
   





**Recruiting manager:** 
 Charlotte Häggroth, +46 703970502
   





 Wemay begin the selection during the application period, so we welcome yourapplication as soon as possible.
   





*We have made our choice regardingrecruitment media and therefore kindly decline contact with ad sellers orsellers of other recruitment services.*
****Swedbank does not discriminate to anybody based on gender, age, sexual orientation or sexual identity, ethnicity, religion or disability – everybody is welcome.****

title: Software Engineer MarTech
description:
**We're looking for a Software Engineer to our MarTech team!**
*This position can be based in Stockholm or Oslo.*
 As a Software Engineer within Martech at Lendo you will design, build, and maintain microservices that enable seamless integrations with key marketing technologies such as Braze, Google Ads and Google Analytics, Meta Ads, etc, as well as support and maintain the data layer implementation. You will ensure the reliability, performance, and scalability of MarTech systems while collaborating closely with specialists to deliver best-practice, efficient, and secure solutions that enhance the organization’s marketing operations.
   

  

 You will work closely with MarTech and analytics implementation specialists, as well as data engineers and data scientists in the Data and Machine Learning team, which is responsible for the entirety of data flows across all markets and brands within Lendo Group.
   

  

**Aspects Of Work Include, But Are Not Limited To**
* Microservices development: Design, develop, and maintain scalable microservices to support MarTech integrations (e.g. Google Ads Customer Match, Enhanced Conversions).
* Tool integration: Collaborate with colleagues in the Data and Machine Learning team and relevant stakeholders to implement and optimize integrations with Braze, Google Ads (Enhanced Conversions, Customer Match), Meta, Google Analytics, and other tools.
* Server-side containers: Maintain the infrastructure for the server-side tag containers and assist in building advanced server-side data collection solutions.
* System maintenance: Implement and maintain monitoring and observability solutions to ensure reliability, performance, and security of the MarTech stack.
* Code quality: Write clean, efficient, well-documented code following best practices.
* Problem-solving: Debug and resolve issues in MarTech systems, ensuring minimal downtime and impact.
* Innovation: Stay up-to-date on the latest MarTech trends and suggest improvements to existing systems and processes.

title: Senior Security Engineer, AWS International Security Team
job_function: Quality Assurance, Information Technology, and Engineering
description:
**Description**
 Job Description:
   

  

 Come and join a creative, diverse, and collaborative team that is changing how we think about Cloud Security! At Amazon Web Services (AWS), Security is our highest priority. The International Security team is responsible for driving innovative enhancements that raise the bar for how AWS employees delivery security Of the cloud to support customer facing engagements.
   

  

 Key job responsibilities
   

  

 Key job responsibilities
   

  

 As a Senior Security Engineer, you’ll help to build and manage security controls that detect and automate the mitigation of cybersecurity threats across Amazon’s infrastructure. You’ll be working for government and regulated industries to understand their detailed security needs. You’ll work with data scientists, software development engineers, and other security engineers across multiple teams to develop innovative security solutions. Our services protect the AWS cloud for all customers and preserves our customers’ trust in us. You’ll get to use the full power and breadth of AWS technologies to build services that proactively protect AWS customers, both internally and externally, from security threats.
   

  

 You will be working in a team of industry-leading security experts working with knowledgeable customers to operate and continuously improve industry-leading security programs and processes. This team manages the underlying security programs and processes for personnel security, physical and logical accreditations, education, awareness and training, assurance, and cyber security. This position will have visibility at senior levels of government agencies, commercial institutions, and AWS including interaction with CISOs, CTOs, their staffs, and AWS senior leadership.
   

  

 In addition to a strong understanding of security technologies, tool development, offensive and defensive security tactics, and ideally some experience with distributed systems, you’ll need a number of other qualities to be successful in this role. The team has a mix of experience levels, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship.
   

  

**About The Team**
 Diverse Experiences
   

  

 Amazon values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
   

  

 Why AWS
   

  

 Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
   

  

 Work/Life Balance
   

  

 We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve in the cloud. Since the Covid19 pandemic we adjusted to remote work and established a hybrid work environment in which engineers spend 3 days working in the office, adjusted to the team needs.
   

  

 Inclusive Team Culture
   

  

 Here at AWS, it’s in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.
   

  

 Mentorship and Career Growth
   

  

 We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
   

  

**Basic Qualifications**
 Basic Qualifications:
   

  

 Extensive experience performing security investigations, penetration testing, and/or incident response in the context of large organisations.
   

  

 In-depth understanding of security threats, hands-on experience detecting and defending from cyber-attacks, and experience using big data analytics and orchestration to address security challenges.
   

  

 Demonstrated technical leadership in security (e.g., tech lead, developed security architecture for a product or system, led technical component of security project, etc.).
   

  

 Experience leading and coaching junior security engineers to improve their skills and effectiveness
   

  

**Preferred Qualifications**
 University Degree in a STEM related field
   

  

 Understanding of the Mitre ATT&CK framework and knowledge of host and network telemetry data (e.g., process lists, application logs, NetFlow)
   

  

 Have awareness and understanding of current cyber security threats, actors and their techniques Experience with data science, big data analytics technology stack, analytic development for endpoint and network security, and streaming technologies (e.g., Kafka, Spark Streaming, and Kinesis)
   

  

 Strong sense of ownership combined with collaborative approach to overcoming challenges and influencing organisational change
   

  

 Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.
   

  

 Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.
   

  

  

**Company** 
 - AWS EMEA SARL (Sweden Branch)
   

  

 Job ID: A2772663

title: SVT söker backendutvecklare - Python / Rust
description:
**Utveckla smarta lösningar som backendutvecklare inom Python / Rust och och ML och bidra till ett mer nyfiket och insatt samhälle!**
 Vill du vara bryggan mellan backend och machine learning (ML) och utveckla system i Python och/eller Rust! På SVT får du chansen att skapa innovativa lösningar inom automatiserad textning och AI, där vi är ledande i Europa. Här får du kombinera teknik, innovation och samhällsnytta – samtidigt som du spelar en nyckelroll i vårt viktiga public service-uppdrag.
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig**
* En organisation i teknisk framkant med en offensiv AI-strategi
* Ett arbete inom Public Service där det viktigaste målet är förbättra upplevelsen för våra användare snarare än att främst mätas på att generera intäkter
* Att bli en del av en modern, snabbrörlig och innovativ organisation där vi är ödmjuka och respekterar varandra – våra produkter är ett resultat av våra medarbetares passion!
* En teknisk bredd och frihet i val av lösningar – vi utvecklar allt från idé till leverans.
* En roll med stor flexibilitet och möjligheten att styra över både arbetsmetoder och tekniska val
* Ett samhällsviktigt uppdrag där du bidrar till att alla ska kunna ta del av SVT:s innehåll
* Delta i teamöverskridande hackdagar och innovationssprintar, med fokus på att utveckla och experimentera inom ditt område


**Det här gör du hos oss**
* Utvecklar och underhåller backendlösningar i bl.a Python och/eller Rust.
* Arbetar med nyutveckling och förbättring av befintliga tjänster.
* Bidrar till optimering av arbetsflöden för automatiserad och manuell textning
* Ansvarar för hela kedjan av tjänster för undertextning


**Ditt team och arbetsplats**
 Du blir en del av teamet Undertext – ett tvärfunktionellt team som representeras av alla kompetenser som behövs för att bygga avancerade tjänster och arbetsverktyg för både interna och externa användare. Teamet består idag av mjukvaruutvecklare, tjänstedesigner, AI/ML engineer, Agil coach och produktägare.
   

  

 Vi erbjuder en flexibel arbetsmiljö där du har möjlighet att jobba 50% hemifrån. Vi ses dock gärna på kontoret då vi gillar att träffas på vårt nyrenoverade kontor. Vi strävar också alltid efter att tillgodose dina tekniska behov, till exempel genom att erbjuda dig den laptop som passar dig bäst.
   

  

**Mer om dig**
 Är du en nyfiken, prestigelös och lösningsorienterad person så tror vi att du kommer att trivas hos oss! Du är öppen för att lära dig om nya domäner och vill jobba med text, ljud, bild och video, även om du inte nödvändigtvis har gjort det tidigare.
   

  

 Vi söker dig med några års erfarenhet inom Python och/eller Rust. Vår tekniska miljö består även av Java, Scala, Go, Azure, Tokio, Dropwizard, Akka, Netty, React, Kafka, RDBMS, NoSQL, Docker, Kubernetes, REST, GraphQL och gRPC. Det är klart positivt om du har intresse eller kunskap av en eller flera av dessa. Vi tror även att du är van att jobba med helheten och har en god förståelse för arkitektur samt van i att jobba med både nyutveckling och äldre system.
   

  

 Vi värdesätter också erfarenhet av arbete i komplexa domäner och en vilja att modernisera och förenkla system.
   

  

 Vi hoppas att du precis som oss motiveras av att jobba med kvalité och att skapa robusta lösningar – vi bygger för användarna!
   

  

**Så här får vi kontakt**
 I den här rekryteringen har vi valt att samarbeta med Ada Digital som strävar efter en transparent, inkluderande och snabbrörlig rekryteringsupplevelse. Vi vill veta mer om dig och din potential! Du söker tjänsten enkelt och behöver inte bifoga några dokument. Det räcker med en motivering till varför du söker tjänsten och om du saknar CV kan du bifoga din LinkedIn-profil. Följ sedan din ansökan live via vår hemsida. Urvalet sker löpande och tjänsten kan bli tillsatt före sista ansökningsdatum. Är du nyfiken och vill veta mer innan du söker? Hör av dig till ansvarig rekryterare. Vi ser fram emot att få kontakt med dig!

title: Senior mjukvaruarkitekt - Critical Care
company_industry: Medical Equipment Manufacturing, Biotechnology Research, and Hospitals and Health Care
description:
**Tillsammans gör vi skillnad**
 På Getinge är vi engagerade i att hjälpa våra kunder att rädda liv och säkerställa utmärkt vård. Vi erbjuder innovativa lösningar för operationsrum, intensivvårdsenheter, steriliseringsavdelningar och för Life Science och institutioner. Ett jobb hos Getinge kommer att ger dig karriärmöjligheter som både inspirerar och utmanar.
   

  

 Vi utökar nu ett av våra utvecklingsteam för att snabba på vår produktutveckling. Bli en del av Getinge och stärk vårt produktområde Critical Care i Solna som senior mjukvaruarkitekt. På Getinge räddar vi liv varje dag och brinner för våra produktlinjer inom intensivvård och anestesiologi.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 Som senior mjukvaruarkitekt på Getinge kommer du att ta nästa generations produkter till marknaden. I samarbete med dina kollegor kommer du att designa och utveckla mjukvara som uppfyller den nödvändiga systemfunktionaliteten och prestandan. I nära samarbete med med olika discipliner inom Critical Care, kommer du att ta dig an komplexa tvärvetenskapliga utmaningar och komma med innovativa mjukvarulösningar. Genom detta kommer du att bidra till utvecklingen av världsledande produkter inom intensivvård och anestesiologi
   

  

**Dina arbetsuppgifter**
 Som senior mjukvaruarkitekt har du en ledande roll i beslutsprocessen när det gäller programvaruimplementering och är med och bestämmer de bästa lösningarna för att leverera den systemfunktionalitet och prestanda som krävs. Du kommer att utföra riskanalyser och jobba för att upprätthålla de högsta kvalitetsstandarderna för vår programvara. Utvecklingen kommer att ledas av teamet i Solna men utvecklingen kommer att genomföras i samarbete med team i Indien.
   

  

 I den här rollen får du en utmärkt överblick över hur alla delar och system i våra maskiner fungerar, kopplat till kunskap om hur produkterna används.
   

  

**Vad du har med dig**
 För att lyckas i den här rollen har du troligen följande egenskaper:
   

  

* Civilingenjörsexamen i datavetenskap, teknisk fysik, elektroteknik eller motsvarande.
* Cirka 10 års erfarenhet av att utveckla integrerade system realtidsoperativsystem med C++.
* Gärna erfarenhet av modern C++ i inbyggda system med modulär och testbar kod.
* Erfarenhet av säkerhetskritiska produkter, lagstiftningar och standarder. Gärna erfarenhet av funktionssäkerhet och/eller cybersäkerhet och om möjligt erfarenhet av produktutveckling inom det medicintekniska området.
* Kunskap om Linux.
* Erfarenhet av modellering, riskanalys och implementering (SysML, EA, etc)
* Kunskap i lågnivåprogrammering (mikroprocessorer, HAL och BSP).
* Kunskap kring board bring-up (Sätta upp uP, kringutrustning) och build for test.
* Erfarenhet av USB-enhetsstack är meriterande.
* Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift är ett krav.


 Förutom tekniska färdigheter värderar vi din personlighet högt. Vi tror att du är en person som är bekväm med att fatta viktiga tekniska beslut och trivs i miljöer med höga förväntningar. Du är en lagspelare som effektivt samarbetar inom tvärfunktionella team, inklusive produktchefer, systemarkitekter och andra ingenjörer. Att jobba med säkerhetskritiska system inom avancerad sjukvård, där funktionalitet och tillförlitlighet är A&O är något du motiveras och drivs av.
   

  

 På Getinge omfamnar vi en lärandekultur där vi tar ansvar för vår utveckling och sätter stort värde på kvalitet och samarbete. Framför allt bryr vi oss om varandra för att vi som team och bolag ska kunna fortsatta utveckla världsledande produkter. Vi är Team Players, Forward Thinkers och Game Changers!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder**
 Vi erbjuder ett konkurrenskraftigt kompensations- och förmånspaket, inklusive friskvårdsbidrag, familjeförmåner och gemensamma aktiviteter och föreningsliv. Allt detta för att säkerställa att vi stöder ditt välbefinnande och dina mål.
   

  

 Vi har en öppen dialog mellan ledare och medarbetare, samt mellan teamen. Vi fokuserar på att utveckla människor och tillsammans skapar vi en plan för lärande och kompetensutveckling när du börjar din karriär hos oss.
   

  

**Ansökan**
 Ansökningar kommer att granskas löpande och vi rekommenderar därför att du skickar in din ansökan så snart som möjligt, dock senast 2025-04-05. Vi ber dig att skicka in din ansökan i vårt rekryteringssystem genom att klicka på knappen "ansök nu". På grund av GDPR tar vi inte emot ansökningar via e-post.
   

  

 Om du har några frågor angående rollen, vänligen kontakta rekryterande chef Markus Kihlén på: markus.kihlen@getinge.com eller rekryterare Sofia Ekstrand på: sofia.ekstrand@getinge.com .
   

  

 Vi hoppas att du vill följa med oss på vår resa mot att bli världens mest eftertraktade MedTech-företag!

title: Översättare Engelska till Svenska - AI Tränare
description:
DataAnnotation är engagerade i att skapa kvalitativ AI. Gå med i vårt team för att hjälpa till att träna AI-chatbotar samtidigt som du får flexibiliteten att arbeta på distans och välja ditt eget schema.
 



  





 Vi söker en tvåspråkig professionell för att gå med i vårt team och lära chatbotar. Du kommer att ha samtal på både svenska och engelska med chatbotar för att mäta deras framsteg, samt skriva nya samtal för att lära dem vad de ska säga.
 



  





**Förmåner:** 



* Detta är en heltids- eller deltidsdistansposition.
* Du kommer att kunna välja vilka projekt du vill arbeta med.
* Du kan arbeta efter eget schema.
* Projekt betalas per timme, med start från 30+ USD per timme, samt bonusar för högkvalitativt och högvolymarbete.



  





**Ansvarsområden (både på svenska och engelska):** 



* Komma på olika samtal inom en rad ämnen.
* Skriva högkvalitativa svar när specifika instruktioner ges.
* Jämföra prestanda för olika AI-modeller.
* Forska och faktagranska AI-svar.



  





**Kvalifikationer:** 



* Flytande i svenska och engelska.
* En kandidatexamen (avslutad eller pågående).
* Utmärkta skriv- och grammatikfärdigheter.
* Stark forsknings- och faktagranskningsförmåga för att säkerställa noggrannhet och originalitet.



  





**Not: Betalning sker via PayPal. Vi kommer aldrig att be om några pengar från dig. PayPal hanterar alla valutakonverteringar från USD.**
